item.title: Bad Cough

Your Peace and Quiet is Affordable

Center for Cough services are covered by Medicare and private insurance. We accept most insurance types and Dr. Sher is a listed preferred provider with most companies. After your initial call to us, we will be able to provide you with an estimate of your insurance benefits and what your out-of-pocket cost may be. At Center for Cough we believe that cost should not be a barrier to seeking treatment. Our team will work with you to reduce obstacles that may be delaying your treatment. We are happy to submit your insurance, Medicare and secondary or supplemental claims. For your convenience, Center for Cough accepts most credit cards. Call TODAYto speak with a team member. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [av_two_third first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-middle' space='no_margin' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Our Location & Travel Information

Center for Cough is located in beautiful Tampa Bay, Florida, conveniently accessible by car and air with proximity to major highways and Tampa International and St. Petersburg/Clearwater Airports. Tampa Bay is home to many cultural and recreational attractions including some of the nation’s most beautiful beaches and waterfront areas, The Dali and Chihuly Museums as well as other visual arts treasures, The Straz, Mahaffey, and Ruth Eckerd Hall Centers for Performing Arts, and major league baseball, football, and hockey teams. Local cuisine features renowned Berns Steak house, fresh fish and seafood, and many other continental and ethnic delights. The Center for Cough team will help out-of-town guests with travel, accommodations, and itinerary to enjoy their stay. Frequently Asked Questions

Constant Coughing Can Be Relieved

Persistent, constant coughing can cause untold stress for the afflicted and their families. These FAQs help you to realize you’re not alone and that treatment is available for relief from constant coughing.

Why am I coughing?

Cough reflex hypersensitivity is most often the cause of cough. Cough reflex hypersensitivity has neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral components. There are many triggers that heighten the sensitivity of the cough reflex such as Asthma, Post nasal drip, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and/or Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. Some of the triggers of cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. Accurately diagnosing the unique cause and triggers of cough in each patient is critical to effective treatment.

Why Choose Center for Cough?

Patients choose Center for Cough for its demonstrated track record of success: 7 out of 10 patients report cough resolution or life improvement, often after the initial visit. Center for Cough develops and works with the cougher to execute an individualized treatment plan aimed at each person’s unique cough profile. A rapid fire, rather than sequential trial and error approach, results in prompt relief. An ongoing partnership between the cougher and Center for Cough results in sustainable success. Center for Cough is the only dedicated center for diagnosing and treating chronic cough in the Southeast region of the United States, and one of a few in the nation. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full]

{{{Why Center For Cough element}}}[av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#ffffff']

Why Choose Center for Cough?

  • SUCCESS WHEN OTHER PHYSICIANS HAVE FAILED: Most of our patients have been coughing for years and have failed multiple medical interventions
  • PROVEN RESULTS: 7 out of 10 patients report life-changing improvement or cough resolution
  • RAPID RELIEF: 1 to 2 office visits for measurable and sustainable results. Diagnosis and treatment plan at the conclusion of the initial visit
  • INDIVIDUALIZED CARE: Each patient’s treatment plan is based on their unique cough trigger profile
  • SUSTAINABLE SUCCESS: We are committed to an ongoing partnership between the Center for Cough team and the cougher
  • FOCUS: One of the few dedicated centers in the United States for comprehensive diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough
  • OUR PHYSICIAN EXPERTISE: National expert on diagnosing and managing chronic cough, Dr. Mandel Sher, Founder and Medical Director of Center for Cough. Educated and trained at Northwestern, Duke, Harvard, and University of Michigan; Clinical Professor of Medicine and Pediatrics, Division of Allergy and Immunology, Morsani College of Medicine at USF Health; Consistently awarded America’s Best Doctor status by peers; Featured speaker on chronic cough
[/av_textblock]

Welcome Message from Dr. Mandel Sher, Medical Director

Thank You for visiting Center for Cough to learn how I and our Center for Cough team can help you or someone you know with nagging, persistent cough attacks that won’t go away.  Chronic cough is a common and complex medical problem but is often under-diagnosed, improperly, and incompletely treated leaving cough sufferers coughing for months or years and feeling hopeless.  Center for Cough specializes in unraveling the triggers and cause of each patient’s cough and measurably improves or resolves the cough completely.

Yours in Good Health,

Mandel R. Sher, MD

[/av_textblock] [av_button label='Learn More About The Center For Cough' link='page,63' link_target='' size='large' position='left' icon_select='yes' icon='ue864' font='entypo-fontello' color='blue' custom_bg='#444444' custom_font='#ffffff'] [/av_one_half] [/av_section]

{{{Page Title}}}[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading heading='Clinical Research' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full]

{{{wide button diag and symptoms}}}[av_button_big label='Learn About Common Chronic Cough Symptoms & Cause' description_pos='below' link='page,1130' link_target='' icon_select='no' icon='ue800' font='entypo-fontello' custom_font='#ffffff' color='grey' custom_bg='#444444' color_hover='theme-color' custom_bg_hover='#444444'][/av_button_big]

{{{diagnosis and Treatment}}}[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading heading='Chronic Cough Diagnosis & Treatment' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Diagnosing Your Cough Some of the triggers of your cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. In order to being effectively treated these triggers must be accurately diagnosed. In almost all cases, diagnosis and treatment planning occurs during a single outpatient visit to the office. The initial consultation includes a thorough medical history and physical exam exploring your cough symptoms and their effects on your daily activities. Previous physician visits, laboratory testing, X-rays, and diagnostic procedures will be reviewed. Based on this evaluation, further testing may be performed at the initial visit using advanced diagnostic tools. The tools may include:
  • Rhinolaryngoscopy
  • Pulmonary function studies
  • Pulmonary inflammatory testing
  • Allergy testing
  • Oropharyngeal pH (acid) probe
  Treating the Cough Reflex Center for Cough initiates a comprehensive, rapid-fire, multi-factorial treatment plan, rather than following a sequential trial and error approach. The cough reflex has three components: neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral. There is no ideal neurogenic cough suppressant available but there are over the counter and prescription medications that can help. If your cough has an inflammatory component and that inflammation is activating the nervous system resulting in activated nerves to cause inflammation, then anti-inflammatory medications can be very effective. If your cough is being influenced from upper brain function and may have a behavioral component, then voice therapy and exercises can be helpful. The effective approach to treating chronic cough requires an individualized cough profile for each patient identifying the neurogenic, inflammatory and behavioral components. Once Dr. Sher assesses your cough’s components, effective treatment can begin. Very often, treatment is a combination of over the counter medications such as antihistamines, prescription medications such as anti-inflammatory remedies, diet modifications, and easy, fast and do at home voice exercises. Sustainable success is enhanced by an ongoing partnership between the Center for Cough team and the chronic cougher.

[/av_textblock] [av_button_big label='Learn About Common Chronic Cough Symptoms & Cause' description_pos='below' link='page,1130' link_target='' icon_select='no' icon='ue800' font='entypo-fontello' custom_font='#ffffff' color='grey' custom_bg='#444444' color_hover='theme-color' custom_bg_hover='#444444'][/av_button_big]

{{{about contact page element}}}[av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#ffffff']

Dr. Mandel Sher

Dr. Sher founded Center for Cough in 2009 after 25 years of diagnosing and effectively treating chronic coughers who had been referred to him by their primary care or specialty physician for what they thought was a cough caused by allergies or asthma. His national and international peers recognize Dr. Sher as a chronic cough expert. He is a frequent lecturer and contributor to clinical and scientific forums on the subject. As part of his commitment to advance the understanding, diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough, Center for Cough participates in clinical research trials of investigational medications seeking FDA approval. [/av_textblock]

Frequently Asked Questions

Why am I coughing?

Cough reflex hypersensitivity is most often the cause of cough. Cough reflex hypersensitivity has neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral components. There are many triggers that heighten the sensitivity of the cough reflex such as Asthma, Post nasal drip, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and/or Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. Some of the triggers of cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. Accurately diagnosing the unique cause and triggers of cough in each patient is critical to effective treatment.

Why Choose Center for Cough?

Patients choose Center for Cough for its demonstrated track record of success: 7 out of 10 patients report cough resolution or life improvement, often after the initial visit. Center for Cough develops and works with the patient to execute an individualized treatment plan aimed at each person’s unique cough profile. A rapid fire, rather than sequential trial and error approach, results in prompt relief. An ongoing partnership between the patient and Center for Cough results in sustainable success. Center for Cough is the only dedicated center for diagnosing and treating chronic cough in the Southeast region of the United States, and one of a few in the nation. Frequently Asked Questions

Constant Coughing Can Be Relieved

Persistent, constant coughing can cause untold stress for the afflicted and their families. These FAQs help you to realize you’re not alone and that treatment is available for relief from constant coughing.

Why am I coughing?

Cough reflex hypersensitivity is most often the cause of cough. Cough reflex hypersensitivity has neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral components. There are many triggers that heighten the sensitivity of the cough reflex such as Asthma, Post nasal drip, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and/or Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. Some of the triggers of cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. Accurately diagnosing the unique cause and triggers of cough in each patient is critical to effective treatment.

Why Choose Center for Cough?

Patients choose Center for Cough for its demonstrated track record of success: 7 out of 10 patients report cough resolution or life improvement, often after the initial visit. Center for Cough develops and works with the cougher to execute an individualized treatment plan aimed at each person’s unique cough profile. A rapid fire, rather than sequential trial and error approach, results in prompt relief. An ongoing partnership between the cougher and Center for Cough results in sustainable success. Center for Cough is the only dedicated center for diagnosing and treating chronic cough in the Southeast region of the United States, and one of a few in the nation. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full]

{{{Why Center For Cough element}}}[av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#ffffff']

Why Choose Center for Cough?

  • SUCCESS WHEN OTHER PHYSICIANS HAVE FAILED: Most of our patients have been coughing for years and have failed multiple medical interventions
  • PROVEN RESULTS: 7 out of 10 patients report life-changing improvement or cough resolution
  • RAPID RELIEF: 1 to 2 office visits for measurable and sustainable results. Diagnosis and treatment plan at the conclusion of the initial visit
  • INDIVIDUALIZED CARE: Each patient’s treatment plan is based on their unique cough trigger profile
  • SUSTAINABLE SUCCESS: We are committed to an ongoing partnership between the Center for Cough team and the cougher
  • FOCUS: One of the few dedicated centers in the United States for comprehensive diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough
  • OUR PHYSICIAN EXPERTISE: National expert on diagnosing and managing chronic cough, Dr. Mandel Sher, Founder and Medical Director of Center for Cough. Educated and trained at Northwestern, Duke, Harvard, and University of Michigan; Clinical Professor of Medicine and Pediatrics, Division of Allergy and Immunology, Morsani College of Medicine at USF Health; Consistently awarded America’s Best Doctor status by peers; Featured speaker on chronic cough
[/av_textblock]

Your Peace and Quiet is Affordable

Center for Cough services are covered by Medicare and private insurance. We accept most insurance types and Dr. Sher is a listed preferred provider with most companies. After your initial call to us, we will be able to provide you with an estimate of your insurance benefits and what your out-of-pocket cost may be. At Center for Cough we believe that cost should not be a barrier to seeking treatment. Our team will work with you to reduce obstacles that may be delaying your treatment. Frequently Asked Questions

Constant Coughing Can Be Relieved

Persistent, constant coughing can cause untold stress for the afflicted and their families. These FAQs help you to realize you’re not alone and that treatment is available for relief from constant coughing.

Why am I coughing?

Cough reflex hypersensitivity is most often the cause of cough. Cough reflex hypersensitivity has neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral components. There are many triggers that heighten the sensitivity of the cough reflex such as Asthma, Post nasal drip, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and/or Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. Some of the triggers of cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. Accurately diagnosing the unique cause and triggers of cough in each patient is critical to effective treatment.

Why Choose Center for Cough?

Patients choose Center for Cough for its demonstrated track record of success: 7 out of 10 patients report cough resolution or life improvement, often after the initial visit. Center for Cough develops and works with the cougher to execute an individualized treatment plan aimed at each person’s unique cough profile. A rapid fire, rather than sequential trial and error approach, results in prompt relief. An ongoing partnership between the patient and Center for Cough results in sustainable success. Center for Cough is the only dedicated center for diagnosing and treating chronic cough in the Southeast region of the United States, and one of a few in the nation. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full]

Welcome Message from Dr. Mandel Sher, Medical Director

Thank You for visiting Center for Cough to learn how I and our Center for Cough team can help you or someone you know with nagging, persistent cough attacks that won’t go away.  Chronic cough is a common and complex medical problem but is often under-diagnosed, improperly, and incompletely treated leaving cough sufferers coughing for months or years and feeling hopeless.  Center for Cough specializes in unraveling the triggers and cause of each patient’s cough and measurably improves or resolves the cough completely.

Yours in Good Health,

Mandel R. Sher, MD

{{{Page Title}}}[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading heading='Clinical Research' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full]

{{{wide button diag and symptoms}}}[av_button_big label='Learn About Common Chronic Cough Symptoms & Cause' description_pos='below' link='page,1130' link_target='' icon_select='no' icon='ue800' font='entypo-fontello' custom_font='#ffffff' color='grey' custom_bg='#444444' color_hover='theme-color' custom_bg_hover='#444444'][/av_button_big]

{{{diagnosis and Treatment}}}[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading heading='Chronic Cough Diagnosis & Treatment' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Diagnosing Your Cough Some of the triggers of your cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. In order to being effectively treated these triggers must be accurately diagnosed. In almost all cases, diagnosis and treatment planning occurs during a single outpatient visit to the office. The initial consultation includes a thorough medical history and physical exam exploring your cough symptoms and their effects on your daily activities. Previous physician visits, laboratory testing, X-rays, and diagnostic procedures will be reviewed. Based on this evaluation, further testing may be performed at the initial visit using advanced diagnostic tools. The tools may include:
  • Rhinolaryngoscopy
  • Pulmonary function studies
  • Pulmonary inflammatory testing
  • Allergy testing
  • Oropharyngeal pH (acid) probe
  Treating the Cough Reflex Center for Cough initiates a comprehensive, rapid-fire, multi-factorial treatment plan, rather than following a sequential trial and error approach. The cough reflex has three components: neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral. There is no ideal neurogenic cough suppressant available but there are over the counter and prescription medications that can help. If your cough has an inflammatory component and that inflammation is activating the nervous system resulting in activated nerves to cause inflammation, then anti-inflammatory medications can be very effective. If your cough is being influenced from upper brain function and may have a behavioral component, then voice therapy and exercises can be helpful. The effective approach to treating chronic cough requires an individualized cough profile for each patient identifying the neurogenic, inflammatory and behavioral components. Once Dr. Sher assesses your cough’s components, effective treatment can begin. Very often, treatment is a combination of over the counter medications such as antihistamines, prescription medications such as anti-inflammatory remedies, diet modifications, and easy, fast and do at home voice exercises. Sustainable success is enhanced by an ongoing partnership between the Center for Cough team and the chronic cougher.

[/av_textblock] [av_button_big label='Learn About Common Chronic Cough Symptoms & Cause' description_pos='below' link='page,1130' link_target='' icon_select='no' icon='ue800' font='entypo-fontello' custom_font='#ffffff' color='grey' custom_bg='#444444' color_hover='theme-color' custom_bg_hover='#444444'][/av_button_big]

{{{about contact page element}}}[av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#ffffff']

Dr. Mandel Sher

Dr. Sher founded Center for Cough in 2009 after 25 years of diagnosing and effectively treating chronic coughers who had been referred to him by their primary care or specialty physician for what they thought was a cough caused by allergies or asthma. His national and international peers recognize Dr. Sher as a chronic cough expert. He is a frequent lecturer and contributor to clinical and scientific forums on the subject. As part of his commitment to advance the understanding, diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough, Center for Cough participates in clinical research trials of investigational medications seeking FDA approval. [/av_textblock]

Frequently Asked Questions

Why am I coughing?

Cough reflex hypersensitivity is most often the cause of cough. Cough reflex hypersensitivity has neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral components. There are many triggers that heighten the sensitivity of the cough reflex such as Asthma, Post nasal drip, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and/or Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. Some of the triggers of cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. Accurately diagnosing the unique cause and triggers of cough in each patient is critical to effective treatment.

Why Choose Center for Cough?

Patients choose Center for Cough for its demonstrated track record of success: 7 out of 10 patients report cough resolution or life improvement, often after the initial visit. Center for Cough develops and works with the patient to execute an individualized treatment plan aimed at each person’s unique cough profile. A rapid fire, rather than sequential trial and error approach, results in prompt relief. An ongoing partnership between the patient and Center for Cough results in sustainable success. Center for Cough is the only dedicated center for diagnosing and treating chronic cough in the Southeast region of the United States, and one of a few in the nation. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [av_button label='View Center for Cough’s FAQ Page' link='page,110' link_target='' size='large' position='center' icon_select='yes' icon='ue84c' font='entypo-fontello' color='theme-color' custom_bg='#444444' custom_font='#ffffff']

{{{patient experience}}}[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading heading='Forms, Insurance & Travel Information' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_one_full first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-top' space='' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Your Peace and Quiet is Affordable

Center for Cough services are covered by Medicare and private insurance. We accept most insurance types and Dr. Sher is a listed preferred provider with most companies. After your initial call to us, we will be able to provide you with an estimate of your insurance benefits and what your out-of-pocket cost may be. At Center for Cough we believe that cost should not be a barrier to seeking treatment. Our team will work with you to reduce obstacles that may be delaying your treatment. We are happy to submit your insurance, Medicare and secondary or supplemental claims. For your convenience, Center for Cough accepts most credit cards. Call TODAYto speak with a team member. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [av_two_third first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-middle' space='no_margin' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Our Location & Travel Information

Center for Cough is located in beautiful Tampa Bay, Florida, conveniently accessible by car and air with proximity to major highways and Tampa International and St. Petersburg/Clearwater Airports. Tampa Bay is home to many cultural and recreational attractions including some of the nation’s most beautiful beaches and waterfront areas, The Dali and Chihuly Museums as well as other visual arts treasures, The Straz, Mahaffey, and Ruth Eckerd Hall Centers for Performing Arts, and major league baseball, football, and hockey teams. Local cuisine features renowned Berns Steak house, fresh fish and seafood, and many other continental and ethnic delights. The Center for Cough team will help out-of-town guests with travel, accommodations, and itinerary to enjoy their stay. Frequently Asked Questions

Constant Coughing Can Be Relieved

Persistent, constant coughing can cause untold stress for the afflicted and their families. These FAQs help you to realize you’re not alone and that treatment is available for relief from constant coughing.

Why am I coughing?

Cough reflex hypersensitivity is most often the cause of cough. Cough reflex hypersensitivity has neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral components. There are many triggers that heighten the sensitivity of the cough reflex such as Asthma, Post nasal drip, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and/or Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. Some of the triggers of cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. Accurately diagnosing the unique cause and triggers of cough in each patient is critical to effective treatment.

Why Choose Center for Cough?

Patients choose Center for Cough for its demonstrated track record of success: 7 out of 10 patients report cough resolution or life improvement, often after the initial visit. Center for Cough develops and works with the cougher to execute an individualized treatment plan aimed at each person’s unique cough profile. A rapid fire, rather than sequential trial and error approach, results in prompt relief. An ongoing partnership between the cougher and Center for Cough results in sustainable success. Center for Cough is the only dedicated center for diagnosing and treating chronic cough in the Southeast region of the United States, and one of a few in the nation. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full]

{{{Why Center For Cough element}}}[av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#ffffff']

Why Choose Center for Cough?

  • SUCCESS WHEN OTHER PHYSICIANS HAVE FAILED: Most of our patients have been coughing for years and have failed multiple medical interventions
  • PROVEN RESULTS: 7 out of 10 patients report life-changing improvement or cough resolution
  • RAPID RELIEF: 1 to 2 office visits for measurable and sustainable results. Diagnosis and treatment plan at the conclusion of the initial visit
  • INDIVIDUALIZED CARE: Each patient’s treatment plan is based on their unique cough trigger profile
  • SUSTAINABLE SUCCESS: We are committed to an ongoing partnership between the Center for Cough team and the cougher
  • FOCUS: One of the few dedicated centers in the United States for comprehensive diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough
  • OUR PHYSICIAN EXPERTISE: National expert on diagnosing and managing chronic cough, Dr. Mandel Sher, Founder and Medical Director of Center for Cough. Educated and trained at Northwestern, Duke, Harvard, and University of Michigan; Clinical Professor of Medicine and Pediatrics, Division of Allergy and Immunology, Morsani College of Medicine at USF Health; Consistently awarded America’s Best Doctor status by peers; Featured speaker on chronic cough
[/av_textblock]

Welcome Message from Dr. Mandel Sher, Medical Director

Thank You for visiting Center for Cough to learn how I and our Center for Cough team can help you or someone you know with nagging, persistent cough attacks that won’t go away.  Chronic cough is a common and complex medical problem but is often under-diagnosed, improperly, and incompletely treated leaving cough sufferers coughing for months or years and feeling hopeless.  Center for Cough specializes in unraveling the triggers and cause of each patient’s cough and measurably improves or resolves the cough completely.

Yours in Good Health,

Mandel R. Sher, MD

[/av_textblock] [av_button label='Learn More About The Center For Cough' link='page,63' link_target='' size='large' position='left' icon_select='yes' icon='ue864' font='entypo-fontello' color='blue' custom_bg='#444444' custom_font='#ffffff'] [/av_one_half] [/av_section]

{{{diagnosis and Treatment}}}[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading heading='Chronic Cough Diagnosis & Treatment' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Diagnosing Your Cough Some of the triggers of your cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. In order to being effectively treated these triggers must be accurately diagnosed. In almost all cases, diagnosis and treatment planning occurs during a single outpatient visit to the office. The initial consultation includes a thorough medical history and physical exam exploring your cough symptoms and their effects on your daily activities. Previous physician visits, laboratory testing, X-rays, and diagnostic procedures will be reviewed. Based on this evaluation, further testing may be performed at the initial visit using advanced diagnostic tools. The tools may include:
  • Rhinolaryngoscopy
  • Pulmonary function studies
  • Pulmonary inflammatory testing
  • Allergy testing
  • Oropharyngeal pH (acid) probe
  Treating the Cough Reflex Center for Cough initiates a comprehensive, rapid-fire, multi-factorial treatment plan, rather than following a sequential trial and error approach. The cough reflex has three components: neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral. There is no ideal neurogenic cough suppressant available but there are over the counter and prescription medications that can help. If your cough has an inflammatory component and that inflammation is activating the nervous system resulting in activated nerves to cause inflammation, then anti-inflammatory medications can be very effective. If your cough is being influenced from upper brain function and may have a behavioral component, then voice therapy and exercises can be helpful. The effective approach to treating chronic cough requires an individualized cough profile for each patient identifying the neurogenic, inflammatory and behavioral components. Once Dr. Sher assesses your cough’s components, effective treatment can begin. Very often, treatment is a combination of over the counter medications such as antihistamines, prescription medications such as anti-inflammatory remedies, diet modifications, and easy, fast and do at home voice exercises. Sustainable success is enhanced by an ongoing partnership between the Center for Cough team and the chronic cougher.

[/av_textblock] [av_button_big label='Learn About Common Chronic Cough Symptoms & Cause' description_pos='below' link='page,1130' link_target='' icon_select='no' icon='ue800' font='entypo-fontello' custom_font='#ffffff' color='grey' custom_bg='#444444' color_hover='theme-color' custom_bg_hover='#444444'][/av_button_big]

{{{about contact page element}}}[av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#ffffff']

Dr. Mandel Sher

Dr. Sher founded Center for Cough in 2009 after 25 years of diagnosing and effectively treating chronic coughers who had been referred to him by their primary care or specialty physician for what they thought was a cough caused by allergies or asthma. His national and international peers recognize Dr. Sher as a chronic cough expert. He is a frequent lecturer and contributor to clinical and scientific forums on the subject. As part of his commitment to advance the understanding, diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough, Center for Cough participates in clinical research trials of investigational medications seeking FDA approval. [/av_textblock]

Your Peace and Quiet is Affordable

Center for Cough services are covered by Medicare and private insurance. We accept most insurance types and Dr. Sher is a listed preferred provider with most companies. After your initial call to us, we will be able to provide you with an estimate of your insurance benefits and what your out-of-pocket cost may be. At Center for Cough we believe that cost should not be a barrier to seeking treatment. Our team will work with you to reduce obstacles that may be delaying your treatment. We are happy to submit your insurance, Medicare and secondary or supplemental claims. For your convenience, Center for Cough accepts most credit cards. Call TODAYto speak with a team member. Our Location & Travel Information

Center for Cough is located in the beautiful Tampa Bay area, Florida, conveniently accessible by car and air with proximity to major highways and Tampa International and St. Petersburg/Clearwater Airports. Tampa Bay is home to many cultural and recreational attractions including some of the nation’s most beautiful beaches and waterfront areas, The Dali and Chihuly Museums as well as other visual arts treasures, The Straz, Mahaffey, and Ruth Eckerd Hall Centers for Performing Arts, and major league baseball, football, and hockey teams. Local cuisine features renowned Berns Steak house, fresh fish and seafood, and many other continental and ethnic delights. The Center for Cough team will help out-of-town guests with travel, accommodations, and itinerary to enjoy their stay. Frequently Asked Questions

Why am I coughing?

Cough reflex hypersensitivity is most often the cause of cough. Cough reflex hypersensitivity has neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral components. There are many triggers that heighten the sensitivity of the cough reflex such as Asthma, Post nasal drip, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and/or Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. Some of the triggers of cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. Accurately diagnosing the unique cause and triggers of cough in each patient is critical to effective treatment.

Why Choose Center for Cough?

Patients choose Center for Cough for its demonstrated track record of success: 7 out of 10 patients report cough resolution or life improvement, often after the initial visit. Center for Cough develops and works with the patient to execute an individualized treatment plan aimed at each person’s unique cough profile. A rapid fire, rather than sequential trial and error approach, results in prompt relief. An ongoing partnership between the patient and Center for Cough results in sustainable success. Center for Cough is the only dedicated center for diagnosing and treating chronic cough in the Southeast region of the United States, and one of a few in the nation. Are You a Candidate for Center for Cough?

  • Do you have a cough for longer than 8 weeks?
  • Are you a non-smoker who has been seen by a physician and have a normal chest x-ray?
  • Are you anxious about going to a movie, church or other public setting for fear of coughing?
  • Are your co-workers annoyed and avoiding you because of your cough?
  • Are your loved ones concerned and frustrated over your chronic cough?
  • Are you sleeping alone because of your chronic cough?
  • Are you having symptoms such as fatigue, urinary incontinence, depression, and feelings of social isolation?

{{{mandel sher}}}[av_section min_height='' min_height_px='500px' padding='small' shadow='no-shadow' bottom_border='border-extra-arrow-down' id='' color='main_color' custom_bg='#0056a1' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' attach='scroll' position='top left' repeat='no-repeat' video='' video_ratio='16:9' overlay_opacity='0.5' overlay_color='' overlay_pattern='' overlay_custom_pattern=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#0056a1']

Dr. Mandel Sher

Dr. Mandel Sher is passionate about helping patients get the most out of their lives.  That is why he is leading a national conversation on chronic cough - an unmet medical need that affects more than 1 out of 10 adults, but is little understood, inaccurately diagnosed, and under-treated.  Dr. Sher founded Center for Cough in 2009 after 25 years of diagnosing and effectively treating patients who coughed repeatedly and who had been referred to him by their doctor. His national and international peers recognize Dr. Sher as a cough expert. He is a frequent lecturer and contributor to clinical and scientific forums on the subject. As part of his commitment to advance the understanding, diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough, Center for Cough participates in clinical research trials of investigational cough medications seeking FDA approval. [/av_textblock] [/av_section]

{{{1111}}}[av_section color='main_color' custom_bg='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' attach='scroll' position='top left' repeat='no-repeat' video='' video_ratio='16:9' min_height='' min_height_px='' padding='large' shadow='no-border-styling' bottom_border='border-extra-arrow-down' id='' custom_class=''] [av_one_full first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-middle' space='no_margin' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading tag='h2' padding='10' heading='Conquer Your Chronic Cough' color='' style='blockquote modern-quote modern-centered' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class=''] Devoted to [/av_heading] [av_textblock size='16' font_color='' color='']

Cough does not have to be so complicated.  Dr. Mandel Sher understands cough and knows how debilitating a cough can be. Center for Cough’s results are remarkable. Over 80% of our patients demonstrate a measurable improvement in their cough – and their lives.

The Center for Cough Difference is the approach used by Dr. Mandel Sher and the Center for Cough team. They take a comprehensive, rather than piecemeal approach, to diagnosing and treating the underlying cause of your cough and the irritants that trigger you to cough. Dr. Sher and the Center for Cough team are medical detectives who listen to patients’ concerns and stories and use advanced diagnostic tools right there in the office to connect the dots and come-up with the right diagnosis and treatment plan for your unique cough.

Dr. Sher is a reknown cough specialist and the only doctor in the Southeast Region of the United States specializing in cough. Many doctors take care of patients with cough but only a few are focused on cough. As the founder of Center for Cough, Dr. Sher and Center for Cough’s clinical and research team offers patients the most effective and innovative care in the field.

Center for Cough services are approved by Medicare and commercial insurance and are conveniently performed in one location during an outpatient office visit.

That is The Center for Cough Difference!

tubeembed
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [/av_section]

Dr. Mandel Sher

Dr. Mandel Sher is passionate about helping patients get the most out of their lives.  That is why he is leading a national conversation on chronic cough - an unmet medical need that affects more than 1 out of 10 adults, but is little understood, inaccurately diagnosed, and under-treated.  Dr. Sher founded Center for Cough in 2009 after 25 years of diagnosing and effectively treating patients who coughed repeatedly and who had been referred to him by their doctor. His national and international peers recognize Dr. Sher as a cough expert. He is a frequent lecturer and contributor to clinical and scientific forums on the subject. As part of his commitment to advance the understanding, diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough, Center for Cough participates in clinical research trials of investigational cough medications seeking FDA approval. [/av_textblock] [/av_section]

{{{5555}}}[av_section min_height='' min_height_px='500px' padding='default' shadow='no-shadow' bottom_border='border-extra-arrow-down' id='' color='main_color' custom_bg='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' attach='scroll' position='top left' repeat='no-repeat' video='' video_ratio='16:9' overlay_opacity='0.5' overlay_color='' overlay_pattern='' overlay_custom_pattern=''] [av_one_third first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-top' space='' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#ffffff']

Are You a Candidate for Center for Cough?

  • Do you have a cough for longer than 8 weeks?
  • Are you a non-smoker who has been seen by a physician and have a normal chest x-ray?
  • Are you anxious about going to a movie, church or other public setting for fear of coughing?
  • Are your co-workers annoyed and avoiding you because of your cough?
  • Are your loved ones concerned and frustrated over your chronic cough?
  • Are you sleeping alone because of your chronic cough?
  • Are you having symptoms such as fatigue, urinary incontinence, depression, and feelings of social isolation?

{{{Home Page 062016}}}[av_section min_height='custom' min_height_px='' padding='large' shadow='no-border-styling' bottom_border='border-extra-arrow-down' scroll_down='aviaTBscroll_down' id='' color='main_color' custom_bg='#0056a1' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' attach='scroll' position='bottom right' repeat='no-repeat' video='' video_ratio='16:9' overlay_opacity='0.5' overlay_color='' overlay_pattern='' overlay_custom_pattern=''] [av_one_fourth first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-top' space='no_margin' custom_margin='aviaTBcustom_margin' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_image src='http://www.cfc.venturoutconsulting.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/drsher-slider-300x188.jpg' attachment='223' attachment_size='medium' align='left' styling='no-styling' hover='' link='page,63' target='_blank' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation'][/av_image] [/av_one_fourth][av_three_fifth min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading heading='The Center for Cough Difference' tag='h2' style='blockquote modern-quote' size='38' subheading_active='subheading_below' subheading_size='18' padding='25' color='custom-color-heading' custom_font='#ffffff'] Do you have a persistent cough that just won’t go away? It’s lasted for months or even years. You’ve tried different cough remedies. You’ve even seen doctors for your cough – but nothing works. Do not give up! You should not learn to live with your cough – Center for Cough can help you. Cough does not have to be so complicated.  Dr. Mandel Sher understands cough and knows how debilitating a cough can be. Center for Cough’s results are remarkable. Over 80% of our patients demonstrate a measurable improvement in their cough – and their lives.

The Center for Cough Difference is the approach used by Dr. Mandel Sher and the Center for Cough team. They take a comprehensive, rather than piecemeal approach, to diagnosing and treating the underlying cause of your cough and the irritants that trigger you to cough. Dr. Sher and the Center for Cough team are medical detectives who listen to patients’ concerns and stories and use advanced diagnostic tools right there in the office to connect the dots and come-up with the right diagnosis and treatment plan for your unique cough.

Dr. Sher is a reknown cough specialist and the only doctor in the Southeast Region of the United States specializing in cough. Many doctors take care of patients with cough but only a few are focused on cough. As the founder of Center for Cough, Dr. Sher and Center for Cough’s clinical and research team offers patients the most effective and innovative care in the field.

Center for Cough services are approved by Medicare and commercial insurance and are conveniently performed in one location during an outpatient office visit.

That is The Center for Cough Difference!

tubeembed
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [/av_section]

Dr. Mandel Sher

Dr. Mandel Sher is passionate about helping patients get the most out of their lives.  That is why he is leading a national conversation on chronic cough - an unmet medical need that affects more than 1 out of 10 adults, but is little understood, inaccurately diagnosed, and under-treated.  Dr. Sher founded Center for Cough in 2009 after 25 years of diagnosing and effectively treating patients who coughed repeatedly and who had been referred to him by their doctor. His national and international peers recognize Dr. Sher as a cough expert. He is a frequent lecturer and contributor to clinical and scientific forums on the subject. As part of his commitment to advance the understanding, diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough, Center for Cough participates in clinical research trials of investigational cough medications seeking FDA approval. [/av_textblock] [/av_section] [av_section min_height='' min_height_px='500px' padding='default' shadow='no-shadow' bottom_border='border-extra-arrow-down' id='' color='main_color' custom_bg='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' attach='scroll' position='top left' repeat='no-repeat' video='' video_ratio='16:9' overlay_opacity='0.5' overlay_color='' overlay_pattern='' overlay_custom_pattern=''] [av_one_third first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-top' space='' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#ffffff']

Are You a Candidate for Center for Cough?

  • Do you have a cough for longer than 8 weeks?
  • Are you a non-smoker who has been seen by a physician and have a normal chest x-ray?
  • Are you anxious about going to a movie, church or other public setting for fear of coughing?
  • Are your co-workers annoyed and avoiding you because of your cough?
  • Are your loved ones concerned and frustrated over your chronic cough?
  • Are you sleeping alone because of your chronic cough?
  • Are you having symptoms such as fatigue, urinary incontinence, depression, and feelings of social isolation?

' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] “I no longer have the constant coughing or the constant clearing of the throat. Not coughing all the time is a big deal. Dr. Sher has made a big difference in my quality of life.” [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Richard D.' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] “I’d been to a number of physicians who had not been able to help me in any way. Within one week, I saw a vast difference. If you just do what your doctor tells you to do, you’ll be fine with Dr. Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Kristen' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] “Dr. Sher took the time to make sure that the treatment he was recommending would not only fix the problem but not cause anthing else. Dr. Sher is very intelligent and knowledgeable and it really comes across when he deals with a patient.” [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Marilyn M' subtitle='Happier Wife of 2.5 year cougher' link='' linktext=''] The repetition was unnerving. He sounded unhealthy. I was worried for my husband, and it was aggravating for me. After one visit with Dr. Mandel Sher at Center for Cough, the change in Tom’s condition was immediate and so satisfying.” [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Anonymous ' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] I highly recommend that anyone who has had a chronic cough must visit Dr. Sher. I have had a cough for over 20 years. We are not sure how or why it all started. Dr. Sher was the first doctor that nailed it for me. I have been to allergists, ear nose and throat, general practitioners, had numerous pictures of my lungs showing no issues...  View On Ucomparehealthcare.com > [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Peggy S.' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] After more than 10 years with a cough Dr. Sher helped me lose it. I had been to every kind of medical doctor and alternative therapy imaginable with no results. But now I'm cough free. av-mini-font-size='' av_uid='av-4mxlc' id='' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''] Cough does not have to be so complicated.  Dr. Mandel Sher understands cough and knows how debilitating a cough can be - especially Chronic Cough. Center for Cough’s results are remarkable. Over 85% of our patients demonstrate a measurable improvement in their cough, throat clearing, hoarseness – and their lives. The Center for Cough Difference is the approach used by Dr. Mandel Sher and the Center for Cough team. They take an evidence-based and comprehensive, rather than piecemeal approach, to diagnosing and treating the underlying cause of your cough and the irritants that trigger you to cough. Dr. Sher and the Center for Cough team are medical detectives who listen to patients’ concerns and stories and use advanced diagnostic tools right there in the office to connect the dots and determine the right diagnosis and cough treatment for your unique cough. Dr. Sher is a renowned cough doctor and the only doctor in the Southeast Region of the United States specializing in cough. Many doctors take care of patients with cough but only a few are focused on cough. As the founder of Center for Cough in the Tampa Bay Area, Dr. Sher and Center for Cough’s clinical and research team offers patients the most effective and innovative care in the field. Center for Cough services are approved by Medicare and commercial insurance and are conveniently performed during a live video telemedicine visit or an in-person outpatient office visit under one roof in our office location. That is the Center for Cough difference. Dr. Mandel Sher

Dr. Mandel Sher is passionate about helping patients get the most out of their lives.  That is why he is leading a national conversation on chronic cough - an unmet medical need that affects more than 1 out of 10 adults, but is little understood, inaccurately diagnosed, and under-treated.  Dr. Sher founded Center for Cough in 2009 after 25 years of diagnosing and effectively treating patients who coughed repeatedly and who had been referred to him by their doctor. His national and international peers recognize Dr. Sher as a cough expert. He is a frequent lecturer and contributor to clinical and scientific forums on the subject. As part of his commitment to advance the understanding, diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough, Center for Cough participates in clinical research trials of investigational cough medications seeking FDA approval. [/av_textblock] [/av_section] [av_section min_height='' min_height_px='500px' padding='default' shadow='no-shadow' bottom_border='border-extra-arrow-down' id='' color='main_color' custom_bg='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' attach='scroll' position='top left' repeat='no-repeat' video='' video_ratio='16:9' overlay_opacity='0.5' overlay_color='' overlay_pattern='' overlay_custom_pattern='' av_uid='av-3b9i6'] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-37yzi'] [av_heading heading='Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough Will Help You' tag='h2' style='blockquote modern-quote modern-centered' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='30' color='' custom_font='' av_uid='av-368zk'] Devoted to [/av_heading] [/av_one_full][av_two_third first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-top' space='' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-33qqo'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#ffffff' av_uid='av-31tgi']
  • Have you been coughing for longer than 8 weeks? Months? Years? Decades?
  • Are you a non-smoker who has been seen by a physician and have a normal chest x-ray?
  • Are you anxious about going to a movie, church or other public setting for fear of coughing?
  • Are you a woman 45+ years of age? (P.S. Men cough too!)
  • Do you feel like you have a tickle, a piece of string, or cotton in the back of your throat?
  • Do you cough while you talk? Exercise? Lay down? Eat or drink alcohol?
  • Do your co-workers avoid you because your cough is annoying them or they think you’re sick?
  • Are your loved ones worried about you?
  • Are you often feeling tired and frustrated from coughing so much for so long?
[/av_textblock] [/av_two_third][av_one_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' BTW, his office staff is very friendly and helpful, especially his wonderful wife." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Byron' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-p8qi'] "I was hesitant to drive from West Palm Beach but I was recommended to Dr. Sher. away? Could it be chronic bronchitis? Or asthma? Or from an ace inhibitor medication? Or are you hard-wired to cough?  You’ve tried different cough treatments. You’ve been coughing for months or years.  You've seen other doctors.  Unexplained chronic cough can be difficult to diagnose and treat.  Dr. Mandel Sher is a leading cough expert in the United States who offers comprehensive cough solutions that often begin with quieting the tickle in the back of your throat that produces urge to cough and coughing episodes. DO NOT GIVE UP! You should not learn to live with your cough – Dr. Mandel Sher will solve your cough.  See why thousands of patients credit Dr. Sher for relieving them from this debilitating condition and changing their life. av-mini-font-size='' av_uid='av-4mxlc' id='' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''] Cough does not have to be so complicated.  Dr. Mandel Sher understands cough and knows how debilitating a cough can be - especially Chronic Cough. Center for Cough’s results are remarkable. Over 85% of our patients demonstrate a measurable improvement in their cough, throat clearing, hoarseness – and their lives. The Center for Cough Difference is the approach used by Dr. Mandel Sher and the Center for Cough team. They take an evidence-based and comprehensive, rather than piecemeal approach, to diagnosing and treating the underlying cause of your cough and the irritants that trigger you to cough. Dr. Sher and the Center for Cough team are medical detectives who listen to patients’ concerns and stories and use advanced diagnostic tools right there in the office to connect the dots and determine the right diagnosis and cough treatment for your unique cough. Dr. Sher is a renowned cough doctor and the only doctor in the Southeast Region of the United States specializing in cough. Many doctors take care of patients with cough but only a few are focused on cough. As the founder of Center for Cough in the Tampa Bay Area, Dr. Sher and Center for Cough’s clinical and research team offers patients the most effective and innovative care in the field. Center for Cough services are approved by Medicare and commercial insurance and are conveniently performed during a live video telemedicine visit or an in-person outpatient office visit under one roof in our office location. That is the Center for Cough difference. Dr. Mandel Sher

Dr. Mandel Sher is passionate about helping patients get the most out of their lives.  That is why he is leading a national conversation on chronic cough - an unmet medical need that affects more than 1 out of 10 adults, but is little understood, inaccurately diagnosed, and under-treated.  Dr. Sher founded Center for Cough in 2009 after 25 years of diagnosing and effectively treating patients who coughed repeatedly and who had been referred to him by their doctor. His national and international peers recognize Dr. Sher as a cough expert. He is a frequent lecturer and contributor to clinical and scientific forums on the subject. As part of his commitment to advance the understanding, diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough, Center for Cough participates in clinical research trials of investigational cough medications seeking FDA approval. [/av_textblock] [/av_section] [av_section min_height='' min_height_px='500px' padding='default' shadow='no-shadow' bottom_border='border-extra-arrow-down' id='' color='main_color' custom_bg='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' attach='scroll' position='top left' repeat='no-repeat' video='' video_ratio='16:9' overlay_opacity='0.5' overlay_color='' overlay_pattern='' overlay_custom_pattern='' av_uid='av-3b9i6'] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-37yzi'] [av_heading heading='Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough Will Help You' tag='h2' style='blockquote modern-quote modern-centered' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='30' color='' custom_font='' av_uid='av-368zk'] Devoted to [/av_heading] [/av_one_full][av_two_third first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-top' space='' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-33qqo'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='custom' color='#ffffff' av_uid='av-31tgi']
  • Have you been coughing for longer than 8 weeks? Months? Years? Decades?
  • Are you a non-smoker who has been seen by a physician and have a normal chest x-ray?
  • Are you anxious about going to a movie, church or other public setting for fear of coughing?
  • Are you a woman 45+ years of age? (P.S. Men cough too!)
  • Do you feel like you have a tickle, a piece of string, or cotton in the back of your throat?
  • Do you cough while you talk? Exercise? Lay down? Eat or drink alcohol?
  • Do your co-workers avoid you because your cough is annoying them or they think you’re sick?
  • Are your loved ones worried about you?
  • Are you often feeling tired and frustrated from coughing so much for so long?
[/av_textblock] [/av_two_third][av_one_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src=''
