columns='2' grid_style='' interval='5' font_color='custom' custom_title='#ffffff' custom_content='#ffffff' av_uid='av-2pmeo' admin_preview_bg=''] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Trina' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-2murq'] "This Center for Cough is where I am going for my chronic cough I have had for Years! I had been sleeping in a recliner for years and now I have been able to finally sleep in the bed without feeling like I was choking to death and coughing! Dr. SHER is awesome and he has a great staff of wonderful, friendly, Very Efficient people! I highly recommend him and his cough center! 10 star rating!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Rebecca S. ' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-2l45a'] "I no longer have the constant coughing or the constant clearing of the throat. Not coughing all the time is a big deal. Dr. Sher has made a big difference in my quality of life." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Vivian' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-2iffc'] "I've been fortunate not to have a chronic cough but twice suffered acute coughs that would not go away with various treatments from other physicians. Dr. Sher took care of those coughs both times, quickly and successfully. He is a kind and caring physician with a great mind. I hope he doesn't retire until I'm no longer on this earth!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Richard D.' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-2hrtc'] "I’d been to a number of physicians who had not been able to help me in any way. Within one week, I saw a vast difference. If you just do what your doctor tells you to do, you’ll be fine with Dr. Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Marilyn' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-2ej7a'] "Dr. Sher has helped us more than once with very thorough explanations and good remedies. We follow his advice and always benefit from his suggestions. He has his patient's good health at the heart of his practice." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Kristen' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-2dovm'] "Dr. Sher took the time to make sure that the treatment he was recommending would not only fix the problem but not cause anthing else. Dr. Sher is very intelligent and knowledgeable and it really comes across when he deals with a patient." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Marilyn M' subtitle='Happier Wife of 2.5 year cougher' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-2amjy'] "The repetition was unnerving. He sounded unhealthy. I was worried for my husband, and it was aggravating for me. After one visit with Dr. Mandel Sher at Center for Cough, the change in Tom’s condition was immediate and so satisfying." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Anonymous ' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-27vra'] "I highly recommend that anyone who has had a chronic cough must visit Dr. Sher. I have had a cough for over 20 years. We are not sure how or why it all started. Dr. Sher was the first doctor that nailed it for me. I have been to allergists, ear nose and throat, general practitioners, had numerous pictures of my lungs showing no issues..."  View On Ucomparehealthcare.com > [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Peggy S.' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-7ria'] "After more than 10 years with a cough Dr. Sher helped me lose it. I had been to every kind of medical doctor and alternative therapy imaginable with no results. But now I'm cough free." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Nancy' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-24xy4'] "I suffered for nearly a year with a chronic cough. Spent $$$ seeing numerous different specialist who has no answers for me but just kept prescribing different meds. One even suggested pretty drastic sinus surgery. Finally a pulmonologist I saw made an offhand reference to the Center for Cough. I looked it up and made an appointment to see Dr Sher even though he was six hours away from my home. After some tests and an initial consultation, he changed my inhaler medication and I was fully recovered in a week. That was three years ago. I have been cough and medication free since. For me, he was a God-send. I think his success stems from the fact that he is a practicing physician but retains the heart of a researcher who strives to understand the actual underlying nature of his patients' illness and thereby treat them appropriately, unlike the cast majority of doctors today who simply follow the doctor playbook." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Vivian' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-228q4'] "Caring compassionate physician using his expertise every day. He gets rid of the cough! Thank you Dr Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Mickey' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-20olk'] "I went to see Dr.Sher about 4 years ago with a chronic cough I got from radiation in 2001 my cough is awful and it is a very hard cough he has tried so many things and if it didn't work he tell me don't give up on me I still have other things I'm working will he did he is involved in a research program that they have a pill they are testing it is a very big success in Europe and I was the first patient to try it and it works when I was on the pill I did not cough I was so happy as he said from the start don't give up on me and I didn't is only the drug company could work faster I am not on the program now the next survey doesn't start until January of 2017 every time I go and see him I ask him where is my pill I think he is the best I have been to so many doctors since 2001 and they all told me there is nothing they can do and I would have to live with the cough but Dr. Sher never gave up on me he keeps looking for something to help me .i think he is the greatest I even made him a t-shirt that says bow ties are cool it also has a bow tie I embroider it thanks Dr.Sher for everything you are doing for me." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Holly' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-6ykw'] "A fantastic doctor! I highly recommend Dr. Mandel Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Welch' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1uq8m'] "I’ve had a chronic cough for over 12 years and have finally found a doctor who has diagnosed it correctly and whose treatment protocol has reduced my coughing spells by at least 50% in just one month. I’ve been approved to participate in one of the cough studies that Dr. Sher is involved in and I’m so excited and hopeful that I’ll continue to do better and better.  Thank you Dr. Sher and your wonderful compassionate staff!!!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Trudy' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1ucpy'] "Just finished a trial for a new cough medicine – Great experience and the medicine really helped." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Tony' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1rf86'] "Doc, You are the best!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Judith' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1oqtm'] "Having moved from NY to Florida was a huge transition. I have allergies , asthma and chronic lung issues. It was not until I saw Dr. Sher that I had a definitive diagnosis .Dr. Sher is steeped in research , academia and is so current. I have been trying to get a diagnosis since 2009. Office staff kind, efficient and responsive . I feel safe in their care. 10 stars!!!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Alta' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1mimy'] "I had coughed for 9 months straight - coughing to the point of throwing up 8-10 times per day. After 2 general Dr, and an ENT, I went to the Center for Cough and was diagnosed as above (nothing in tests showed up anything). After a dose of steroids, the chlorpheniramine is all I take and I have been cough free since 2 days after my appointment. I am living proof that this works!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Carolyn' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1lf46'] "Dr Sher has been my doctor for years...... He has helped me immensely thru the years. He is thoughtful, intelligent and truly dedicated to his practice and to the desire to get you well and living the best healthy quality that works for you. His office staff is just as dedicated and thoughtful as Dr. Sher. If I could have only one Dr treat me for all my medical conditions it would be Dr. Sher . He has a great team/staff glad I found them!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Cheryl' subtitle='' link=' ' linktext='' av_uid='av-1j34u'] "Dr. Mandel and his staff are wonderful. If you have a chronic cough, this is the place." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Linda' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1fsee'] "I am not surprised !(that Dr. Sher is the ONLY Allergy, Asthma, and Cough Physician Specialist in Pinellas County selected by his physician peers as 2016 Best Doctor) Dr. Sher was the ONLY doctor I've seen to figure out the cause of and what to do about my constant problem with stuffiness and constant coughing. I believe in him 100%! [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Connie' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-54nk'] I went to every specialist I thought might help me to no avail. Then I met Dr. Sher. Oh my goodness! After 4 years of coughing, I had a visit with Dr. Sher and almost immediately my cough was gone. I sure do wish it hadn't taken me so long to find him. Thanks Dr. Sher [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Trish' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1brk8'] Great Place.  No kidding Dr. Sher and his staff saved my life. I had a cough for well over 10 years. I came to see him and in 1 visit he had it nailed. I'm so lucky to have met Dr. Sher And his staff [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Sharon G.' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1ajji'] "Doctor Sher cured me. I had a cough for more than a year!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Trish' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-184ja'] Great Man, really helped me when no one else could. Thanks Dr. [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Linda' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-16gya'] Dr. Mandel Sher thank you for continuing in your fathers footsteps...You are passionate and caring and of course the best! Thank you for helping our family through the years. [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Sue' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-13una'] Awesome! Dr Sher gave me my life back...forever grateful. [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Diana' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-10tj8'] We love you Dr. Sher!! [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Emily' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-znnq'] Most incredible Dr.! Always goes the extra mile for his patients and friends. There are few Drs. More dedicated than Dr. Sher! [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Susan' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-xd6a'] "Dr. Sher helped a friend of mine when numerous other physicians could not. We traveled across the state to see him. It was worth every trip. He literally changed my friends quality of life and saved his career ." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Susan' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-v60u'] "Dr. Sher and his team are phenomenal!! Thank you so much!!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Annette' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-tlpm'] "I was they today for consult And testing. I was impressed with the doctor And staff." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Earl' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-ra96'] "After suffering for months with cough seizures a friend suggested Dr. Sher at The Center for Cough. The appointment easy to schedule, the staff very friendly and attentive. Dr. Sher himself is thorough and conscientious and extremely professional. After following his therapy suggestions I am happy to report my cough is now under control and I am able to return to work. Kudos to Dr. Sher and his staff. BTW, his office staff is very friendly and helpful, especially his wonderful wife." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Byron' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-p8qi'] "I was hesitant to drive from West Palm Beach but I was recommended to Dr. Sher. Upon getting to the office I was impressed with the friendliness of the office staff. They were very professional and treated us as if we were their only patient. The staff restored my belief in great customer service. Dr. Sher did not rush my time with him and he explained everything to me. I can say after 20 years trying to figure out my issue, Dr. Sher was able to.  I would recommend Dr. Sher and his staff." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Beth' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-m1fo'] "Dr. Sher and staff really care about their patients. They saw us promptly about an urgent matter and set us in the right direction. Thank you so much. They are worth the drive." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Caren' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-kw5k'] "Dr. Sher was a tremendous help getting rid of my annoying cough. He was the first doctor to help clear my problem. He is kind, caring, funny and a great doctor." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Marci' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1vim'] "I had a persistent cough that would not go away. After seeing Dr. Sher, he correctly diagnosed the problem and with his guidance on diet, exercise therapy and medicine the cough is gone. I had a cough lingering for almost 7 months and Dr. Sher, quickly got the problem solved. I would call him the "Cough Whisperer" His staff was friendly and effective and thorough. I would highly recommend Dr. Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Linda' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-fp7a'] "After about 10 years of coughing, this amazing doctor stopped my coughing within 24 hours of my first visit. Thoroughly impressed with the ability since I had seen so many specialists around the country before finding Dr. Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Nadine' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-dh3o'] "Having procrastinated long enough, it was time to finally see a physician about my breathing issues. I was sure it was asthma, but feared it could be something worse. I can't say enough wonderful things about my experience at Dr. Sher's office. Over the phone, I never felt rushed as I chatted about my symptoms. At check in I was met with smiling greeters who didn't make me feel like an interruption to their very busy day. Dr. Sher was ever so patient and thorough with me. The nursing staff, extremely compassionate. Turns out it was nothing to worry about. For thorough, compassionate care, this is the place." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Fran' subtitle='Love This Doctor...' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-c2oe'] "Went to see Dr. Sher yesterday for my cough and was totally amazed at his knowledge and how he plans to help me. I would highly recommend Dr. Sher to anyone who has a long lasting cough....Love this doctor." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Dayna' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-9pqm'] "I have never been so impressed with a doctor as I was with Dr. Sher at the Center for Cough. The time he spent and the information he shared and also explaining everything was incredible. I highly recommend Dr. Sher and the Center for Cough." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Denise S.' subtitle='Dr. Sher Saved My Life!' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-2ja6'] "I am an RN of 25 years and have had a cough for my entire life. For 3 years it was severe. I went to countless specialists & had every test available, all offering ZERO answers. I was on 12 prescription meds with ZERO improvement. Dr. Sher has saved my life! I no longer need a laundry list of meds or to spend every day off in a doctor’s office. I finally have a normal life without a hacking cough, exhaustion, embarrassment & constant disruption to everyone around me. Everyone there is great!" [/av_testimonial_single] [/av_testimonials] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-88mo']

Read more patient success stories.

[/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [/av_section] [av_three_fifth first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-4plw'][/av_three_fifth] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-9xa'][/av_one_full]

item.title: The Center for Cough Team
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-chftz'] [av_heading tag='h1' padding='10' heading='Meet The Center For Cough Team' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' av_uid='av-bg3b7'][/av_heading] [av_image src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/shutterstock_339601190-1500x430.jpg' attachment='3722' attachment_size='featured' align='center' styling='' hover='' link='' target='' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-b51pb'][/av_image] [/av_one_full] [av_one_third first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_breaking='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-aj8tr'] [av_team_member name='Dr. Mandel Sher' job='Cough Specialist' src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Mandel-podium-e1496893303127-180x180.jpg' attachment='3153' attachment_size='square' image_width='' description='' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-9o253'][/av_team_member] [/av_one_third] [av_two_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_breaking='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-wmcr'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-8jfkb'] Dr. Mandel Sher is the Principal Investigator for all clinical trials at Center for Cough.  Dr. Sher is assisted by the Center for Cough team who are specifically trained and skilled in successfully managing a clinical research study.  Some of the responsibilities of the Clinical Research Center's team are:
  • Screening and enrolling qualified volunteers
  • Following the study protocol
  • Coordinating treatment and visits
  • Complying with regulatory requirements for clinical trials
  • Maintaining complete and accurate records
Clinical Research Center's team members have long-term experience in caring for patients, especially those with chronic respiratory illnesses.  All of the Clinical Research Center's team are selected based on their attention to detail, knowledge, skills, and organizational skills needed to successfully manage a clinical research study.  Equally important are their personal attributes including effective communication skills and patient-centered "can do" attitude to accommodate scheduling requests. [/av_textblock] [/av_two_third] [av_hr class='short' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' font='entypo-fontello' av_uid='av-j3e7'] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-4bu2v'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' av_uid='av-eb3f' admin_preview_bg=''] The Center for Cough team comprises clinical, administrative, and clinical research trial experts.  Each team member is selected for their competence and temperament.  Dr. Mandel Sher recruits and retains talented and dedicated professionals who are an extension of his standards of excellence.  Each of our team members are patient advocates and ambassadors.  So, if it matters to you, then it matters to us.  Remarkable outcomes, service, and a satisfying experience are our goals. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av_uid='av-3cn9b'] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-2oypn'] [av_heading heading='Center For Cough Blog Updates' tag='h3' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' av_uid='av-26sp7'][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_blog blog_type='posts' categories='1,86,8,7,89,26' link='category' blog_style='blog-grid' columns='4' contents='title_read_more' content_length='content' preview_mode='custom' image_size='medium' items='4' offset='0' paginate='yes' conditional='' av_uid='av-1la8n'] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av_uid='av-15d63']

av_uid='av-wmcr'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-8jfkb'] Dr. Mandel Sher is the Principal Investigator for all clinical trials at Center for Cough.  Dr. Sher is assisted by the Center for Cough team who are specifically trained and skilled in successfully managing a clinical research study.  Some of the responsibilities of the Clinical Research Center's team are:
  • Screening and enrolling qualified volunteers
  • Following the study protocol
  • Coordinating treatment and visits
  • Complying with regulatory requirements for clinical trials
  • Maintaining complete and accurate records
Clinical Research Center's team members have long-term experience in caring for patients, especially those with chronic respiratory illnesses.  All of the Clinical Research Center's team are selected based on their attention to detail, knowledge, skills, and organizational skills needed to successfully manage a clinical research study.  Equally important are their personal attributes including effective communication skills and patient-centered "can do" attitude to accommodate scheduling requests. item.title: Symptoms & Causes
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading heading='Symptoms & Causes' tag='h1' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Common Chronic Cough Symptoms

[/av_textblock] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg='']

Persistent or chronic cough disrupts relationships, participation in social situations, professional performance, and recreational activities.  In other words, constant cough disrupts life.  Chronic cough symptoms may include:

[av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='#'][/av_font_icon]Cough while talking [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='#'][/av_font_icon]Throat clearing [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Sore throat [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Hoarseness [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Post-nasal drip [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Tickle in the back of your throat [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Cough with exercise [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Cough with or after meals [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Cough triggered by alcohol, chocolate, breath mints, fatty foods, or caffeine [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Night-time cough [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Why do some people cough and others do not? There are two types of cough reflex: a primitive/basic cough reflex that prevents us from choking on food and other foreign objects, and a chemosensory cough reflex that responds to infectious/viral, and other topical irritants. Patients with chronic cough are often “hard wired to cough” and have a hypersensitive (excessively sensitive) cough reflex pathway. The chronic cougher tends to have an increased urge to cough. It can be described as a tickle in the back of the throat. Sometimes it can be a feeling that something is stuck there. Often, there is a feeling of post nasal drip, but rarely any is produced. Some of the triggers of your cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. In order to be effectively treated these silent triggers must be accurately diagnosed. A hypersensitive or heightened cough reflex requires less stimuli, such as nasal secretions, airborne irritants, acid or gastroesophageal reflux, to trigger a chronic cough. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Chronic Cough Causes

[/av_textblock] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Chronic cough is the result of cough reflex hypersensitivity with triggers from associated conditions such as post nasal drip, acid reflux and asthma. The cough reflex has neurogenic, inflammatory, behavioral and anatomic triggers, and the key to quieting a hypersensitive cough reflex is identifying your unique cough profile and treating it accordingly. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [av_image src='http://www.cfc.venturoutconsulting.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/11/reflect-arc.png' attachment='1538' attachment_size='full' align='center' styling='' hover='' link='' target='' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation'][/av_image] [av_one_half first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Which illnesses or conditions trigger cough? 
  • One of the keys to effective treatment is accurately and completely diagnosing your unique cough trigger(s). A trigger is what sets-off your cough. Sometimes the trigger(s) is surprising or silent. Below are the most common chronic cough triggers.
  • Upper respiratory viral infections (like the common cold) are potent triggers of cough. The cough reflex can be sensitized for weeks, even months, after a viral respiratory infection
  • Post nasal drip may trigger a cough
  • Nasal and sinus inflammation from a viral infection, allergies, or sinusitis can activate the cough reflex
  • Acid reflux can directly trigger a cough. Acidic and non acidic food refluxing into the esophagus can activate/heighten the cough reflex
  • Asthma may trigger a cough
  • Lung inflammation, particularly eosinophilic/allergic, can sensitize the cough reflex
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_one_half min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] What are the steps leading-up to a cough?
  • Cough receptors in the upper airway (nose), larynx (voice box), lung, and esophagus are activated by direct irritation such as throat infection, post nasal drip or gastric acid (which has contact with the receptors in the larynx/voice box)
  • The receptors send a signal to the cough center in the lower brain area
  • The cough center then decides if there is enough stimulus to set off a cough
  • The cough center becomes hyperactive by repeated stimulation from the peripheral cough receptors
  • The cough center is also influenced by higher brain function which can result in a voluntary and habit cough
  • Stimulation of the upper airway, esophagus, and lung can heighten or sensitize the cough reflex without actually triggering off a cough. For example, acid or even food entering the esophagus from the stomach can send signals to the cough center to become more sensitive or irritable. Allergic nasal symptoms also send signals to the cough center and increase sensitivity.
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_button_big label='Learn About Chronic Cough Diagnosis & Treatment' description_pos='below' link='page,1327' link_target='_blank' icon_select='no' icon='ue800' font='entypo-fontello' custom_font='#ffffff' color='grey' custom_bg='#444444' color_hover='theme-color' custom_bg_hover='#444444'][/av_button_big] [/av_one_full]

  • Upper respiratory viral infections (like the common cold) are potent triggers of cough. The cough reflex can be sensitized for weeks, even months, after a viral respiratory infection
  • Post nasal drip may trigger a cough
  • Nasal and sinus inflammation from a viral infection, allergies, or sinusitis can activate the cough reflex
  • Acid reflux can directly trigger a cough. Acidic and non acidic food refluxing into the esophagus can activate/heighten the cough reflex
  • Asthma may trigger a cough
  • Lung inflammation, particularly eosinophilic/allergic, can sensitize the cough reflex
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_one_half min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-79sqzu'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-6g3fmi'] What are the steps leading-up to a cough?
  • Cough receptors in the upper airway (nose), larynx (voice box), lung, and esophagus are activated by direct irritation such as throat infection, post nasal drip or gastric acid (which has contact with the receptors in the larynx/voice box)
  • The receptors send a signal to the cough center in the lower brain area
  • The cough center then decides if there is enough stimulus to set off a cough
  • The cough center becomes hyperactive by repeated stimulation from the peripheral cough receptors
  • The cough center is also influenced by higher brain function which can result in a voluntary and habit cough
  • Stimulation of the upper airway, esophagus, and lung can heighten or sensitize the cough reflex without actually triggering off a cough. For example, acid or even food entering the esophagus from the stomach can send signals to the cough center to become more sensitive or irritable. Allergic nasal symptoms also send signals to the cough center and increase sensitivity.
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-4dmbka'] [av_button_big label='Learn About Chronic Cough Diagnosis & Treatment' description_pos='below' link='page,1327' link_target='_blank' icon_select='no' icon='ue800' font='entypo-fontello' custom_font='#ffffff' color='grey' custom_bg='#444444' color_hover='theme-color' custom_bg_hover='#444444' av_uid='av-27ktl6'][/av_button_big] [/av_one_full]
Cough can be a symptom of a serious medical problem. The underlying cause of Chronic Cough can be difficult to identify and is often overlooked.

item.title: Clinical Research
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher

background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading tag='h1' padding='10' heading='Clinical Research Center' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' for Cough' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size=''][/av_heading] [av_image src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/Clinical_research_doctor-1500x630.jpg' attachment='3555' attachment_size='featured_large' align='center' styling='' hover='' link='' target='' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation' admin_preview_bg=''][/av_image] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg=''] Thank You for your interest in the Clinical Research Center, a division of Center for Cough. The Clinical Research Center at Center for Cough is our hub for clinical trials, also known as clinical studies. Clinical trials evaluate the effectiveness and safety of drugs and devices that are being considered for FDA approval and for availability to the public. This page introduces you to clinical research and the reasons you may want to consider volunteering for a clinical trial at Center for Cough. Clinical trial volunteers make a significant contribution toward advancing effective medical treatment and improved health outcomes. Dr. Mandel Sher and the Center for Cough team are proud to be designated a clinical trials site and offering clinical studies as a treatment option. [/av_textblock] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg=''] Protecting patient safety and patient privacy is the highest priority in conducting clinical trials. Clinical research is regulated and carefully monitored to ensure that the highest standards of compliance are being met. Doctors who conduct clinical trials are also known as clinical research Investigators. Dr. Mandel Sher is the Principal Investigator for clinical research at Center for Cough. Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough have consistently been selected as a site for clinical studies based on their thorough and careful enrollment process, availability of a dedicated Clinical Research Nurse Coordinator to explain information and address questions, positive experience and high satisfaction among clinical trial volunteers, and reliable and accurate data collection. Dr. Mandel Sher is a national leader in diagnosing and treating people suffering with chronic cough. As part of his passion for improving outcomes for this under-diagnosed and under-treated debilitating medical condition, Dr. Sher is also a frequent speaker at national professional society meetings, and leading investigator of clinical trials evaluating cough drugs. Dr. Sher has been leading clinical trials at Center for Cough since 2009, and has been participating in clinical research for other medical indicators for decades. Dr. Sher is one of only a handful of dedicated cough doctors in the United States. His collaboration with cough doctors, scientists, and researchers around the world put him at the forefront of Cough treatment. [/av_textblock] [av_promobox button='no' label='Contact Us Today' link='manually,http://centerforcough.com/contact-center-for-cough/' link_target='' color='theme-color' custom_bg='#444444' custom_font='#ffffff' size='large' icon_select='no' icon='ue800' font='entypo-fontello' box_color='' box_custom_font='#ffffff' box_custom_bg='#444444' box_custom_border='#333333' admin_preview_bg=''] You do not need to be a current patient of Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough in order to be eligible to participate in a clinical trial. Patients who qualify for clinical research and those who do not, are all treated to the same standard of world-class cough care and patient service at Center for Cough. All clinical trials are conducted in a private, well equipped medical setting in our mid-Pinellas County location in the Tampa Bay area of Florida. [/av_promobox] [av_toggle_container initial='1' mode='toggle' sort='' styling='' colors='' font_color='' background_color='' border_color=''] [av_toggle title='Current Clinical Trials' tags=''] View our currently enrolling clinical trials. If interested in participating in a clinical research trial, but do not see one you may qualify for at this time, please follow our Facebook page or call to get on our future volunteer list so we can keep you informed of upcoming opportunities. [/av_toggle] [av_toggle title='What is a Clinical Research Trial?' tags=''] Clinical trials are research studies that investigate new treatments or devices. The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) reviews and analyzes information from clinical trials to determine whether a drug or device should be approved and made available to the public. Medications that are available now have resulted from successful clinical research and FDA approval. Clinical trials give patients access to cutting-edge treatments before they become available to the public. In addition to acting proactively to benefit yourself now, by volunteering for a clinical trial you will be helping others by advancing tomorrow’s medicines today. Get answers to the most frequently asked questions about how and why clinical trials are conducted at Center for Cough. [/av_toggle] [av_toggle title='What Clinical Trial Volunteers Are Saying' tags=''] Read what our clinical trial volunteers are saying about their experience participating in a clinical research study at the Center for Cough Clinical Research Center. [/av_toggle] [/av_toggle_container] [/av_one_full]
item.excerpt:encoded: Center for Cough located in the Tampa Bay area, conducts clinical research studies as part of the process of FDA approval for new treatment options for chronic cough. These studies are sponsored by pharmaceutical companies and give patients who qualify, and volunteer to participate in these studies, access to the most current treatment options before they become available to the general public.

item.title: Diagnosis & Treatment
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading heading='Diagnosis & Treatment' tag='h1' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808'] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading heading='Diagnosing Chronic Cough' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg='']

You May Be Hardwired To Cough!

Everyone coughs.  Cough is the body’s defense mechanism to protect us from choking or inhaling foreign particles. But some coughs have no purpose.  A persistent cough, also known as a chronic cough, is simply irritating to you and annoying to others.  This type of generally dry and constant cough is caused by a hypersensitive cough response.  People who have a chronic cough that is caused by a hypersensitive cough response are hardwired to cough.  Simply put, the nerve endings at the back of the throat are overly-sensitive, easily irritated, and result in chronic cough. In the medical literature, this type of cough is referred to as "hypersensitive cough reflex."  In order to optimize the effectiveness of your chronic cough treatment, accurately diagnosing the underlying reason(s) for coughing is essential. Diagnosis includes identifying your persistent cough's triggers, otherwise known as the irritants that produce cough.  Very often, there are multiple triggers.  Common irritants that result in cough in those people who have a hypersensitive cough response are:  post nasal drip, acid and non-acid reflux, and cough asthma/lung inflammation. In almost all cases, Dr. Sher will diagnose the cause and trigger(s) of your cough and develop a personalized treatment plan targeted at your unique cough during the initial evaluation. The initial evaluation includes a thorough medical history and physical exam exploring your cough symptoms and their consequences. Previous physician visits, laboratory testing, X-rays, and diagnostic procedures will be reviewed. Then, further testing may be performed during this visit using advanced diagnostic tools.  The tools may include:
  • Rhinolaryngoscopy
  • Pulmonary function studies
  • Pulmonary inflammatory testing
  • Allergy testing
  • Oropharyngeal pH (acid) probe

[/av_textblock] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808'] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading tag='h2' padding='10' heading='Chronic Cough Treatment' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg='']

Treating  the persistent cough

Chronic cough treatment includes treating cough reflex hypersensitivity and the identified anatomic causes  which can include upper airway/post nasal drip,  acid and non-acid reflux and cough asthma/lung inflammation The cough reflex has three components: neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral. There is no ideal neurogenic cough suppressant available but there are over the counter and prescription medications that can help. If your cough has an inflammatory component and that inflammation is activating the nervous system resulting in activated nerves to cause inflammation, then anti-inflammatory medications can be very effective. If your cough is being influenced from upper brain function and may have a behavioral component, then voice therapy and exercises can be helpful. Your individual cough profile will identify the neurogenic, inflammatory and behavioral components of your unique cough. Once Dr. Sher assesses your cough’s components, effective treatment can begin. Very often, treatment is a combination of over the counter medications, prescription medications, diet modifications, and easy, fast and do at home voice exercises. Sustainable success is enhanced by an ongoing partnership between the Center for Cough team and the patient. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_button_big label='Learn About Common Chronic Cough Symptoms & Causes' description_pos='below' link='page,1130' link_target='_blank' icon_select='no' icon='ue800' font='entypo-fontello' custom_font='#ffffff' color='grey' custom_bg='#444444' color_hover='theme-color' custom_bg_hover='#444444'][/av_button_big] [/av_one_full]

item.title: Thank You For Contacting Center for Cough
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_heading heading='Thank You For Contacting Center For Cough' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Thank you for contacting Center For Cough, below you will find information regarding insurance, travel information and downloadable forms. We recommend saving this email to reference again before your appointment. One of the Center for Cough team members will be in touch with you via your preferred method of contact to confirm your upcoming visit or address any questions or concern you may have. Thank you, Dr. Mandel Sher & The Center for Cough Team [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_one_full first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-top' space='' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Your Peace and Quiet is Affordable

Center for Cough services are covered by Medicare and private insurance. We accept most insurance types and Dr. Sher is a listed preferred provider with most companies. After your initial call to us, we will be able to provide you with an estimate of your insurance benefits and what your out-of-pocket cost may be. At Center for Cough we believe that cost should not be a barrier to seeking treatment. Our team will work with you to reduce obstacles that may be delaying your treatment. We are happy to submit your insurance, Medicare and secondary or supplemental claims. For your convenience, Center for Cough accepts most credit cards. Call TODAYto speak with a team member. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [av_two_third first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-middle' space='no_margin' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Our Location & Travel Information

Center for Cough is located in beautiful Tampa Bay, Florida, conveniently accessible by car and air with proximity to major highways and Tampa International and St. Petersburg/Clearwater Airports. Tampa Bay is home to many cultural and recreational attractions including some of the nation’s most beautiful beaches and waterfront areas, The Dali and Chihuly Museums as well as other visual arts treasures, The Straz, Mahaffey, and Ruth Eckerd Hall Centers for Performing Arts, and major league baseball, football, and hockey teams. Local cuisine features renowned Berns Steak house, fresh fish and seafood, and many other continental and ethnic delights. The Center for Cough team will help out-of-town guests with travel, accommodations, and itinerary to enjoy their stay. [/av_textblock] [/av_two_third] [av_one_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_codeblock wrapper_element='' wrapper_element_attributes=''] [/av_codeblock] [/av_one_third] [av_heading tag='h3' padding='10' heading='Center For Cough Patient Forms' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class=''][/av_heading] [av_one_fourth first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-middle' space='no_margin' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='#000000' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation=''] [av_icon_box position='left' boxed='' icon='ue823' font='entypo-fontello' title='1. Preparing for your first visit' link='manually,http://www.cfc.venturoutconsulting.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/01/Preparing-for-your-first-visit.pdf' linktarget='_blank' linkelement='both' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' color='' custom_bg='' custom_font='' custom_border=''][/av_icon_box] [av_icon_box position='left' boxed='' icon='ue823' font='entypo-fontello' title='5. Frequently Asked Questions

Constant Coughing Can Be Relieved

Persistent, constant coughing can cause untold stress for the afflicted and their families. These FAQs help you to realize you’re not alone and that treatment is available for relief from constant coughing.

Why am I coughing?

Cough reflex hypersensitivity is most often the cause of cough. Cough reflex hypersensitivity has neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral components. There are many triggers that heighten the sensitivity of the cough reflex such as Asthma, Post nasal drip, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and/or Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. Some of the triggers of cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. Accurately diagnosing the unique cause and triggers of cough in each patient is critical to effective treatment.

Why Choose Center for Cough?

Patients choose Center for Cough for its demonstrated track record of success: 7 out of 10 patients report cough resolution or life improvement, often after the initial visit. Center for Cough develops and works with the cougher to execute an individualized treatment plan aimed at each person’s unique cough profile. A rapid fire, rather than sequential trial and error approach, results in prompt relief. An ongoing partnership between the cougher and Center for Cough results in sustainable success. Center for Cough is the only dedicated center for diagnosing and treating chronic cough in the Southeast region of the United States, and one of a few in the nation. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full]

Thank you, Dr. Mandel Sher & The Center for Cough Team [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_one_full first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-top' space='' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-100m20q'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-xlnp4a']

Your Peace and Quiet is Affordable

Center for Cough services are covered by Medicare and private insurance. We accept most insurance types and Dr. Sher is a listed preferred provider with most companies. After your initial call to us, we will be able to provide you with an estimate of your insurance benefits and what your out-of-pocket cost may be. At Center for Cough we believe that cost should not be a barrier to seeking treatment. Our team will work with you to reduce obstacles that may be delaying your treatment. We are happy to submit your insurance, Medicare and secondary or supplemental claims. For your convenience, Center for Cough accepts most credit cards. Call TODAYto speak with a team member. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [av_two_third first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-middle' space='no_margin' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-wvehca'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-v08kl6']

Our Location & Travel Information

Center for Cough is located in beautiful Tampa Bay, Florida, conveniently accessible by car and air with proximity to major highways and Tampa International and St. Petersburg/Clearwater Airports. Tampa Bay is home to many cultural and recreational attractions including some of the nation’s most beautiful beaches and waterfront areas, The Dali and Chihuly Museums as well as other visual arts treasures, The Straz, Mahaffey, and Ruth Eckerd Hall Centers for Performing Arts, and major league baseball, football, and hockey teams. Local cuisine features renowned Berns Steak house, fresh fish and seafood, and many other continental and ethnic delights. The Center for Cough team will help out-of-town guests with travel, accommodations, and itinerary to enjoy their stay. item.title: New Patient Information
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_heading heading='Center For Cough Patient Information' tag='h1' link_apply='' link='' link_target='' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' margin='' padding='20' color='' custom_font='' custom_class='' id='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size=''][/av_heading] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av_uid='av-18jq3bn'] [av_three_fifth first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-15s2k37'] [av_heading heading='Insurance Information' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' av_uid='av-144bhtf'][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-128t5j7']

Your Peace and Quiet is Affordable

Center for Cough services are covered by Medicare and private insurance. We accept most insurance types and Dr. Sher is a listed preferred provider with most companies. After your initial call to us, we will be able to provide you with an estimate of your insurance benefits and what your out-of-pocket cost may be. At Center for Cough we believe that cost should not be a barrier to seeking treatment. Our team will work with you to reduce obstacles that may be delaying your treatment. We are happy to submit your insurance, Medicare and secondary or supplemental claims. For your convenience, Center for Cough accepts most credit cards. Call TODAY to speak with a team member. [/av_textblock] [/av_three_fifth] [av_two_fifth min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-11q0xeb'] [av_image src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/07/healthins.jpeg' attachment='2955' attachment_size='full' align='center' styling='' hover='' link='' target='' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation' av_uid='av-zph9c3'][/av_image] [/av_two_fifth] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av_uid='av-xcacdv'] [av_heading heading='Center For Cough New Patient Forms' tag='h2' link_apply='' link='' link_target='' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' margin='' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' custom_class='' id='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-uc30wj'] Please help us to prepare for your visit and save time upon your arrival by printing out and completing the patient forms in advance of your appointment.  Once you make your appointment, a Center for Cough team member will let you know which of the numbered forms listed below will be needed for your visit. [/av_textblock] [av_one_fourth first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-middle' space='no_margin' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='#000000' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-szzexv'] [av_icon_box position='left' icon_style='' boxed='' icon='ue823' font='entypo-fontello' title='1. COUGH Questionnaire' heading_tag='' heading_class='' link='manually,http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/CENTER-FOR-COUGH-QUESTIONNAIRE.pdf' linktarget='_blank' linkelement='both' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' color='' custom_bg='' custom_font='' custom_border='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' av_uid='av-qz5gib' id='' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''][/av_icon_box] [/av_one_fourth] [av_one_fourth min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-nnwc1f'] [/av_one_fourth][av_one_fourth min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-jd5rwz'][/av_one_fourth] [av_one_fourth min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-ebe4xf'][/av_one_fourth] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av_uid='av-9i3a5v'] [av_heading heading='Center for Cough FAQ' tag='h2' link_apply='' link='' link_target='' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' margin='' padding='25' color='' custom_font='' custom_class='' id='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-6geldv']

1.Am I a candidate for Center for Cough?

If you are a non-smoker with normal chest x-rays who has a cough that is lasting for more than eight weeks, then you are a candidate for Center for Cough.

2.Why am I coughing?

Cough reflex hypersensitivity is most often the cause of cough. Cough reflex hypersensitivity has neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral components. There are many triggers that heighten the sensitivity of the cough reflex such as Asthma, Post nasal drip, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and/or Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. Some of the triggers of cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. Accurately diagnosing the unique cause and triggers of cough in each patient is critical to effective treatment.

3.Who has chronic cough?

Chronic cough affects men, women, and children. There is a measurable, heightened cough reflex sensitivity in women, often caused by allergic triggers, infections, irritants, and reflexive pathways such as stimulation of the esophagus.

4.Why Choose Center for Cough?

Patients choose Center for Cough for its demonstrated track record of success: 7 out of 10 patients report cough resolution or life improvement, often after the initial visit. Center for Cough develops and works with the cougher to execute an individualized treatment plan aimed at each person’s unique cough profile. A rapid fire, rather than sequential trial and error approach, results in prompt relief. An ongoing partnership between the cougher and Center for Cough results in sustainable success. Center for Cough is the only dedicated center for diagnosing and treating chronic cough in the Southeast region of the United States, and one of a few in the nation.

5.How will Center for Cough determine why I’m coughing?

During an initial consultation, Dr. Sher will review your symptoms, medical history, and conduct a physical examination. In some cases, additional diagnostic tests will be recommended and can be performed at Center for Cough during the initial visit.

6.If I’ve been coughing for months or even years, can Center for Cough help improve or resolve my cough?

Yes. In most non-smokers with normal chest x-rays, there are underlying triggers of cough that have not been properly diagnosed and treated. Center for Cough’s comprehensive diagnostic approach identifies causes and the triggers of cough and recommends an individualized treatment plan targeted at those causes and triggers. Many Center for Cough patients arrive feeling hopeless and believing their cough will never improve or go away. Their lives are transformed through Center for Cough’s diagnostic approach and effective treatment.

7.What will be my treatment?

Every treatment plan is personalized to effectively target the cause(s) of cough. All treatment options are easily integrated into daily life and will not result in missed work, school or other limitations. Treatment options may include:
  • Over the counter and/or prescription medications
  • Diet
  • Lifestyle
  • Environment
  • Voice exercises

8.If I’m coming in from out-of-town how long will I have to stay in your area?

Generally, an initial evaluation at Center for Cough is conclusive and can be completed all in one visit lasting several hours. You will leave the appointment with a treatment plan that can be easily implemented in your home community. Center for Cough is conveniently located to Tampa International Airport and all major highways. If an overnight stay is necessary, Center for Cough will be happy to assist you with lodging, dining, and activity choices in the area.
[/av_textblock] [av_one_full first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-middle' space='no_margin' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-e8xwj'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-2ejtlv']

Resources

  • Montefiore.org Pulmonary Cough Center
  • Mayoclinic.org Chronic Cough Definition
  • Hopkinsmedicine.org Chronic Cough Conditions
  • NationalJewish.org Cough Conditions
  • Manchester.ac.uk Jacky Smith Research
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_full]

custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av_uid='av-9i3a5v'] [av_heading heading='Center for Cough FAQ' tag='h2' link_apply='' link='' link_target='' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' margin='' padding='25' color='' custom_font='' custom_class='' id='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' av_uid='av-2255cz'][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-6geldv']

1.Am I a candidate for Center for Cough?

If you are a non-smoker with normal chest x-rays who has a cough that is lasting for more than eight weeks, then you are a candidate for Center for Cough.

2.Why am I coughing?

Cough reflex hypersensitivity is most often the cause of cough. Cough reflex hypersensitivity has neurogenic, inflammatory, and behavioral components. There are many triggers that heighten the sensitivity of the cough reflex such as Asthma, Post nasal drip, Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and/or Angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. Some of the triggers of cough may be silent. A silent trigger is one where cough is the only symptom. Accurately diagnosing the unique cause and triggers of cough in each patient is critical to effective treatment.

3.Who has chronic cough?

Chronic cough affects men, women, and children. There is a measurable, heightened cough reflex sensitivity in women, often caused by allergic triggers, infections, irritants, and reflexive pathways such as stimulation of the esophagus.

4.Why Choose Center for Cough?

Patients choose Center for Cough for its demonstrated track record of success: 7 out of 10 patients report cough resolution or life improvement, often after the initial visit. Center for Cough develops and works with the cougher to execute an individualized treatment plan aimed at each person’s unique cough profile. A rapid fire, rather than sequential trial and error approach, results in prompt relief. An ongoing partnership between the cougher and Center for Cough results in sustainable success. Center for Cough is the only dedicated center for diagnosing and treating chronic cough in the Southeast region of the United States, and one of a few in the nation.

5.How will Center for Cough determine why I’m coughing?

During an initial consultation, Dr. Sher will review your symptoms, medical history, and conduct a physical examination. In some cases, additional diagnostic tests will be recommended and can be performed at Center for Cough during the initial visit.

6.If I’ve been coughing for months or even years, can Center for Cough help improve or resolve my cough?

Yes. In most non-smokers with normal chest x-rays, there are underlying triggers of cough that have not been properly diagnosed and treated. Center for Cough’s comprehensive diagnostic approach identifies causes and the triggers of cough and recommends an individualized treatment plan targeted at those causes and triggers. Many Center for Cough patients arrive feeling hopeless and believing their cough will never improve or go away. Their lives are transformed through Center for Cough’s diagnostic approach and effective treatment.

7.What will be my treatment?

Every treatment plan is personalized to effectively target the cause(s) of cough. All treatment options are easily integrated into daily life and will not result in missed work, school or other limitations. Treatment options may include:
  • Over the counter and/or prescription medications
  • Diet
  • Lifestyle
  • Environment
  • Voice exercises

8.If I’m coming in from out-of-town how long will I have to stay in your area?

Generally, an initial evaluation at Center for Cough is conclusive and can be completed all in one visit lasting several hours. You will leave the appointment with a treatment plan that can be easily implemented in your home community. Center for Cough is conveniently located to Tampa International Airport and all major highways. If an overnight stay is necessary, Center for Cough will be happy to assist you with lodging, dining, and activity choices in the area.
[/av_textblock] [av_one_full first min_height='av-equal-height-column' vertical_alignment='av-align-middle' space='no_margin' margin='0px' margin_sync='true' padding='0px' padding_sync='true' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' radius_sync='true' background_color='' src='' attachment='' attachment_size='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' av_uid='av-e8xwj'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-2ejtlv']

Resources

  • Montefiore.org Pulmonary Cough Center
  • Mayoclinic.org Chronic Cough Definition
  • Hopkinsmedicine.org Chronic Cough Conditions
  • NationalJewish.org Cough Conditions
  • Manchester.ac.uk Jacky Smith Research
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_full]

To have your cough evaluated, treated, and resolved, please call our office to set up a telehealth or an in-person appointment. Have a Cough that Won't Go Away? Dr. Mandel Sher Can Help.
