item.title: Dr. Mandel Sher
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading tag='h1' padding='10' heading='Dr. Mandel Sher' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class=''][/av_heading] [av_heading heading='Tampa Bay Area’s Cough Specialist' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full][av_one_half first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading tag='h3' padding='10' heading='Mandel Sher, M.D.' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class=''][/av_heading] [av_image src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/drsher-slider.jpg' attachment='223' attachment_size='full' align='center' styling='' hover='' link='page,1190' target='_blank' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation'][/av_image] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Dr. Mandel Sher founded Center for Cough in 2009 after 25 years of diagnosing and effectively treating patients with chronic cough in Sher Allergy Specialists.  As the only dedicated Cough Doctor in the Tampa Bay area, State of Florida, and southeast region of the country, Center for Cough offers patients a comprehensive approach to cough diagnosis and cough treatment.  Services are offered on an outpatient basis in one convenient office location. Center for Cough is located in the Tampa Bay area of Florida, conveniently accessible to residents or seasonal visitors of the west coast of Florida including Orlando, Tampa, St. Petersburg, Fort Myers, Sarasota, and Naples.  Patients from Georgia, Louisiana, South Carolina, North Carolina, Texas, and seasonal visitors from Michigan, Illinois, Ohio, Canada and other origins make Center for Cough a destination.  Chronic cough is recognized as a significant medical problem by Dr. Sher’s colleagues at world-class medical institutions such as Mayo Clinic, Montefiore Medical Center in New York, Johns Hopkins Medicine, and National Jewish Health in Denver, Colorado.  Dr. Sher and Center for Cough bring world-class care closer to home. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_one_half min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Dr. Mandel Sher’s career includes the following accomplishments and honors:

[/av_textblock] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Medical education and training at the nation’s leading medical centers: Northwestern University, Duke, Harvard, and the University of Michigan.
  • Board Certified in Allergy, Asthma and Immunology
  • Adult and Pediatric Specialist in respiratory disorders, and a subspecialist in cough, in private practice since 1984
  • Clinical Professor of Medicine and Pediatrics, Division of Allergy and Immunology, Morsani College of Medicine at USF Health
  • Interim Chief, Division of Allergy and Immunology, USF Health
  • Interim Chief, Division of Allergy and Immunology, Johns Hopkins All Children's Hospital
  • Expert Cough Presenter to national physician audiences:  American Academy of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology, American College of Allergy and Immunology, American Thoracic Society, World Allergy Organization, Florida Allergy, Asthma & Immunology Society
  • Recognized by peers continuously as: [av_font_icon icon='ue800' font='fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='15px' position='left' color=''][/av_font_icon]“Tampa Bay’s Top Doctors" [av_font_icon icon='ue800' font='fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='15px' position='left' color=''][/av_font_icon]"Best Doctor In America" [av_font_icon icon='ue800' font='fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='15px' position='left' color=''][/av_font_icon] “The Best Doctors in the Southeast"
[/av_textblock] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] As part of Dr. Sher’s commitment to advance the understanding, diagnosis and treatment of chronic cough, Center for Cough participates in national clinical research trials aimed at offering patients new and improved medications.  Dr. Sher is easily recognizable by the bowties he ties by himself and enjoys wearing. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808'] [av_one_half first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_icon_box position='left_content' boxed='' icon='ue854' font='entypo-fontello' title='Schedule an Appointment' link='page,1816' linktarget='_blank' linkelement='both' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' color='' custom_bg='' custom_font='' custom_border=''] Call us today to schedule an appointment with Dr. Mandel Sher:  727-393-8067. [/av_icon_box] [/av_one_half] [av_one_half min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_icon_box position='left' boxed='' icon='ue80a' font='entypo-fontello' title='Meet Our Team' link='page,63' linktarget='' linkelement='' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' color='' custom_bg='' custom_font='' custom_border=''] Learn more about the dedicated Clinical and Administrative Team at Center for Cough. [/av_icon_box] [/av_one_half]

Dr. Mandel Sher founded Center for Cough in 2009 after 25 years of diagnosing and effectively treating patients with chronic cough in the Tampa Bay Area.

item.title: About Chronic Cough
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading tag='h1' padding='10' heading='About Chronic Cough' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''][/av_heading] [av_heading tag='h2' padding='10' heading='What is Chronic Cough?' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg=''] Chronic Cough is generally a cough that lasts 8 weeks or longer.  Persistent Cough, Constant Cough, Dry Cough, and Nagging Cough are other terms often used to describe this type of cough.  Chronic Cough can be an indication of a serious underlying medical problem.  Often, Chronic Cough is THE problem! Persistent, nagging cough should not be ignored.  People who constantly cough should not learn to live with it.  Each cough is unique.  A comprehensive cough evaluation by an expert Cough Doctor will identify the precise cause and trigger of your cough and result in effective Chronic Cough treatment and sustainable relief.  Chronic Cough often has more than one cause and more than one trigger.  In fact, some cough patients have so many triggers that set-off a constant cough cycle that they consider themselves "Trigger Happy." Chronic Cough has debilitating physical and mental health consequences that adversely affect relationships, professional performance, and participation in social and recreational activities.  In short, Chronic Cough is disruptive and gets in the way of the quality of daily life. People with Chronic Cough describe feeling afraid that something really serious could be the cause.  Some report feeling embarrassed, depressed, anxious, or frustrated about their cough.  Depressed because they are socially isolated; Embarrassed because all eyes are on them while their cough interrupts quiet zones.  Anxious because their colleagues avoid working with them for fear that they are sick and contagious.  And, frustrated because in spite of consulting many doctors and trying different cough remedies, they are still coughing.  Fatigue and Urinary Incontinence are other common consequences. [/av_textblock] [av_heading tag='h2' padding='10' heading='Why Do Some People Cough And Others Do Not?' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_one_third first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_image src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/anatomy-of-cough.jpg' attachment='2740' attachment_size='full' align='center' styling='' hover='' link='' target='' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation'][/av_image] [av_textblock size='10' font_color='custom' color='#828282']

Image source: health.harvard.edu

[/av_textblock] [/av_one_third] [av_two_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Cough is good!  But too much of anything is no good.  The goal of cough treatment is to normalize your cough, not get rid of it completely.  Primitive or basic cough prevents us from choking on food and other foreign objects.  Chronic Cough, however, has NO useful function; it's only purpose is to irritate. People with Chronic Cough can be “hard wired to cough.” In medical lingo, this is also known as a hypersensitive cough reflex or neurogenic cough.  This simply means that the nerve endings at the back of the throat are overly sensitive.  When these nerve endings are ignited by triggers such as allergies, post nasal drip, upper respiratory infections and other irritants, then the already sensitive nerve endings are set-on fire and result in cough.  Cough begets Cough, so the more you cough, the more you will cough. The scientific finding of hypersensitive cough reflex is recent.  Knowing that some people are "hard wired to cough" helps us to understand why only some people have a constant cough when others are exposed to the very same irritants and do not cough. [/av_textblock] [/av_two_third] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading tag='h2' padding='10' heading='Common Chronic Cough Symptoms' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

You may have chronic cough if your life is being disrupted by any of these symptoms:

[av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='#'][/av_font_icon]Cough while talking [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='#'][/av_font_icon]Throat clearing [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Sore throat [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Hoarseness [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Post-nasal drip [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Tickle in the back of your throat [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Cough with exercise [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Cough with or after meals [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Cough triggered by alcohol, chocolate, breath mints, fatty foods, or caffeine [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='']Night-time cough [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [av_one_half first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

What are the steps leading-up to a cough?

  • Urge to cough.  People with Chronic Cough report feeling like there's something stuck in the back of the throat.
  • Cough receptors in the upper airway (nose), larynx (voice box), lung, and esophagus are activated by direct irritation such as throat infection, post nasal drip or gastric acid (which has contact with the receptors in the larynx/voice box)
  • The receptors send a signal to the cough center in the lower brain area
  • The cough center then decides if there is enough stimulus to set off a cough
  • The cough center becomes hyperactive by repeated stimulation from the peripheral cough receptors
  • The cough center is also influenced by higher brain function which can result in a voluntary and habit cough
  • Stimulation of the upper airway, esophagus, and lung can heighten or sensitize the cough reflex without actually triggering off a cough. For example, acid or even food entering the esophagus from the stomach can send signals to the cough center to become more sensitive or irritable. Allergic nasal symptoms also send signals to the cough center and increase sensitivity.
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_one_half min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Which medical conditions cause and trigger cough? 

  • Being hard-wired to cough, also known as hypersensitive cough reflex.  This means nerve endings at the back of the throat become irritated by triggers such as upper respiratory infection and nasal allergies and set-off constant cough.
  • Upper respiratory viral infections (like the common cold)
  • Post nasal drip
  • Sinusitis
  • Acid reflux or GERD
  • Asthma
  • Non-asthmatic inflammation
  • Blood pressure medication
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808'] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading tag='h2' padding='10' heading='Diagnosing Chronic Cough' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg=''] There are different types of cough resulting from different medical conditions.  Cough treatment and relief relies on accurately determining the type and underlying reason of  your cough.  For example, cough can be associated with bronchitis. However, bronchitis symptoms with cough and a bronchitis diagnosis are vastly different from Chronic Cough diagnosis and treatment.  Diagnosis includes identifying the different aspects of cough reflex hypersensitivity AND  identifying anatomic causes  which can include upper airway/post nasal drip,  acid and non-acid reflux and cough asthma/lung inflammation. In almost all cases, diagnosis, your individual cough profile, and your personalized treatment plan targeted at your unique cough will be completed during the initial evaluation at Center for Cough. The initial evaluation includes a thorough medical history and physical exam exploring your cough symptoms and their consequences. Previous physician visits, laboratory testing, X-rays, and diagnostic procedures will be reviewed. Then, further testing may be performed during this visit using advanced diagnostic tools.  The tools may include:
  • Rhinolaryngoscopy
  • Pulmonary function studies
  • Pulmonary inflammatory testing
  • Allergy testing
  • Oropharyngeal pH (acid) probe
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808'] [av_one_half first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_icon_box position='left' boxed='' icon='ue808' font='entypo-fontello' title='Treating Your Cough' link='page,2716' linktarget='' linkelement='both' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' color='' custom_bg='' custom_font='' custom_border=''] Learn more about chronic cough treatment. [/av_icon_box] [/av_one_half] [av_one_half min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_icon_box position='left' boxed='' icon='ue854' font='entypo-fontello' title='Schedule an Appointment' link='' linktarget='' linkelement='' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' color='' custom_bg='' custom_font='' custom_border=''] If you have symptoms of chronic cough, schedule an appointment with the Cough Doctor today. [/av_icon_box] [/av_one_half]

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1o37566'] [av_heading tag='h1' padding='10' heading='About Chronic Cough' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-1msv6vi'][/av_heading] [av_heading tag='h2' padding='10' heading='What is Chronic Cough?' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-1lnpx9a'][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-1jl90wu'] Chronic Cough is generally a cough that lasts 8 weeks or longer.  Persistent Cough, Constant Cough, Dry Cough, and Nagging Cough are other terms often used to describe this type of cough.  Chronic Cough can be an indication of a serious underlying medical problem.  Often, Chronic Cough is THE problem! Persistent, nagging cough should not be ignored.  People who constantly cough should not learn to live with it.  Each cough is unique.  A comprehensive cough evaluation by an expert Cough Doctor will identify the precise cause and trigger of your cough and result in effective Chronic Cough treatment and sustainable relief.  Chronic Cough often has more than one cause and more than one trigger.  In fact, some cough patients have so many triggers that set-off a constant cough cycle that they consider themselves "Trigger Happy." Chronic Cough has debilitating physical and mental health consequences that adversely affect relationships, professional performance, and participation in social and recreational activities.  In short, Chronic Cough is disruptive and gets in the way of the quality of daily life. People with Chronic Cough describe feeling afraid that something really serious could be the cause.  Some report feeling embarrassed, depressed, anxious, or frustrated about their cough.  Depressed because they are socially isolated; Embarrassed because all eyes are on them while their cough interrupts quiet zones.  Anxious because their colleagues avoid working with them for fear that they are sick and contagious.  And, frustrated because in spite of consulting many doctors and trying different cough remedies, they are still coughing.  Fatigue and Urinary Incontinence are other common consequences. [/av_textblock] [av_heading tag='h2' padding='10' heading='Why Do Some People Cough And Others Do Not?' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-1he8l7y'][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_one_third first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1fqwbcu'] [av_image src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/anatomy-of-cough.jpg' attachment='2740' attachment_size='full' align='center' styling='' hover='' link='' target='' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation' av_uid='av-1e346i6'][/av_image] [av_textblock size='10' font_color='custom' color='#828282' av_uid='av-1djkqfi']

Image source: health.harvard.edu

[/av_textblock] [/av_one_third] [av_two_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1bybowe'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-19t2p5q'] Cough is good!  But too much of anything is no good.  The goal of cough treatment is to normalize your cough, not get rid of it completely.  Primitive or basic cough prevents us from choking on food and other foreign objects.  Chronic Cough, however, has NO useful function; it's only purpose is to irritate. People with Chronic Cough can be “hard wired to cough.” In medical lingo, this is also known as a hypersensitive cough reflex or neurogenic cough.  This simply means that the nerve endings at the back of the throat are overly sensitive.  When these nerve endings are ignited by triggers such as allergies, post nasal drip, upper respiratory infections and other irritants, then the already sensitive nerve endings are set-on fire and result in cough.  Cough begets Cough, so the more you cough, the more you will cough. The scientific finding of hypersensitive cough reflex is recent.  Knowing that some people are "hard wired to cough" helps us to understand why only some people have a constant cough when others are exposed to the very same irritants and do not cough. [/av_textblock] [/av_two_third] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-17yhsku'] [av_heading tag='h2' padding='10' heading='Common Chronic Cough Symptoms' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' av_uid='av-16gya5a'][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-150lf7i']

You may have chronic cough if your life is being disrupted by any of these symptoms:

[av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='#' av_uid='av-13h4926'][/av_font_icon]Cough while talking [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='#' av_uid='av-3qfy72'][/av_font_icon]Throat clearing [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='' av_uid='av-z5jwem']Sore throat [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='' av_uid='av-ylsb4e']Hoarseness [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='' av_uid='av-wlmklq']Post-nasal drip [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='' av_uid='av-v24bvi']Tickle in the back of your throat [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='' av_uid='av-2wys1a']Cough with exercise [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='' av_uid='av-s3pqn2']Cough with or after meals [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='' av_uid='av-pgjtb2']Cough triggered by alcohol, chocolate, breath mints, fatty foods, or caffeine [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='20px' position='left' color='' av_uid='av-niavn2']Night-time cough [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [av_one_half first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-26v4vi'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-l67efy']

What are the steps leading-up to a cough?

  • Urge to cough.  People with Chronic Cough report feeling like there's something stuck in the back of the throat.
  • Cough receptors in the upper airway (nose), larynx (voice box), lung, and esophagus are activated by direct irritation such as throat infection, post nasal drip or gastric acid (which has contact with the receptors in the larynx/voice box)
  • The receptors send a signal to the cough center in the lower brain area
  • The cough center then decides if there is enough stimulus to set off a cough
  • The cough center becomes hyperactive by repeated stimulation from the peripheral cough receptors
  • The cough center is also influenced by higher brain function which can result in a voluntary and habit cough
  • Stimulation of the upper airway, esophagus, and lung can heighten or sensitize the cough reflex without actually triggering off a cough. For example, acid or even food entering the esophagus from the stomach can send signals to the cough center to become more sensitive or irritable. Allergic nasal symptoms also send signals to the cough center and increase sensitivity.
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_one_half min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-icvupq'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-haooji']

Which medical conditions cause and trigger cough? 

  • Being hard-wired to cough, also known as hypersensitive cough reflex.  This means nerve endings at the back of the throat become irritated by triggers such as upper respiratory infection and nasal allergies and set-off constant cough.
  • Upper respiratory viral infections (like the common cold)
  • Post nasal drip
  • Sinusitis
  • Acid reflux or GERD
  • Asthma
  • Non-asthmatic inflammation
  • Blood pressure medication
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av_uid='av-f987xa'] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-ejyl0e'] [av_heading tag='h2' padding='10' heading='Diagnosing Chronic Cough' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-co7vsu'][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-ahd0q6'] There are different types of cough resulting from different medical conditions.  Cough treatment and relief relies on accurately determining the type and underlying reason of  your cough.  For example, cough can be associated with bronchitis. However, bronchitis symptoms with cough and a bronchitis diagnosis are vastly different from Chronic Cough diagnosis and treatment.  Diagnosis includes identifying the different aspects of cough reflex hypersensitivity AND  identifying anatomic causes  which can include upper airway/post nasal drip,  acid and non-acid reflux and cough asthma/lung inflammation. In almost all cases, diagnosis, your individual cough profile, and your personalized treatment plan targeted at your unique cough will be completed during the initial evaluation at Center for Cough. The initial evaluation includes a thorough medical history and physical exam exploring your cough symptoms and their consequences. Previous physician visits, laboratory testing, X-rays, and diagnostic procedures will be reviewed. Then, further testing may be performed during this visit using advanced diagnostic tools.  The tools may include:
  • Rhinolaryngoscopy
  • Pulmonary function studies
  • Pulmonary inflammatory testing
  • Allergy testing
  • Oropharyngeal pH (acid) probe
[/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av_uid='av-8p39z2'] [av_one_half first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-77gz8e'] [av_icon_box position='left' boxed='' icon='ue808' font='entypo-fontello' title='Treating Your Cough' link='page,2716' linktarget='' linkelement='both' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' color='' custom_bg='' custom_font='' custom_border='' av_uid='av-5lg2m6'] Learn more about chronic cough treatment. [/av_icon_box] [/av_one_half] [av_one_half min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-4qqqy6'] [av_icon_box position='left' boxed='' icon='ue854' font='entypo-fontello' title='Schedule an Appointment' link='' linktarget='' linkelement='' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' color='' custom_bg='' custom_font='' custom_border='' av_uid='av-blsny'] If you have symptoms of chronic cough, schedule an appointment with the Cough Doctor today. [/av_icon_box] [/av_one_half]
"Chronic Cough," "Persistent Cough" or "Constant Cough" refer to a cough lasting 8 weeks or longer. This complex medical condition requires a Cough Expert.

item.title: Cough Treatment
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading tag='h1' padding='10' heading='Chronic Cough Treatment' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class=''][/av_heading] [av_image src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/homepage_image.jpg' attachment='217' attachment_size='full' align='left' styling='' hover='' link='' target='' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation'][/av_image] [/av_one_full] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading heading='Precise Identification of Cough’s Cause is the Most Important Step for Effective Cough Treatment' tag='h3' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg='']

Diagnosis

Not all coughs are created equal.  Most people suffering with Chronic Cough have had this condition for months or years and have tried, but failed, different cough remedies.  For this reason, a diagnosis of Chronic Cough should carefully consider each person's medical narrative and history.  Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough team are cough detectives who listen to each patient carefully and cull vital information from medical records to put-together your cough puzzle.  Center for Cough offers a comprehensive scope of services in one office location to precisely identify the cause(s) and trigger(s) of cough. Dr. Mandel Sher's and Center for Cough's services are all traditional, evidence-based medicine.  Dr. Sher's approach to putting-together your cough puzzle and cough treatment includes innovative components based on Dr. Sher's role in groundbreaking cough drug development and appreciation of lifestyle and behavioral contributions to cough. Dr. Mandel Sher at Center for Cough is specially trained and one of few doctors in the Tampa Bay area using Rhinoscope during an outpatient office visit to examine nasal passages.  Center for Cough also offers FeNO challenge to evaluate the role of asthma and non-asthmatic airway inflammation in cough.

Cough Treatment

Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough's results are remarkable!  Over 85% of patients demonstrate cough reduction and report an overall improvement in feeling good and the quality of their lives.  Many of these patients have seen other doctors for their cough and tried and failed other chronic cough treatments before finally seeing Dr. Sher. Center for Cough recommends cough treatment that targets multiple cough causes and triggers all at once.  This comprehensive approach is more effective in breaking the cough cycle and bringing much-needed and lasting cough relief. A trial-and-error approach to chronic cough treatment used by other doctors delays cough relief, increases frustration, exposes patients to unnecessary risks and side effects from medications that are not targeted to the precise type of cough, and waste money.  Chronic Cough is an under-diagnosed, under-treated, and under-appreciated medical condition in the United States.   Dr. Mandel Sher takes the guesswork out of cough treatment! A comprehensive cough treatment plan is recommended at the end of the initial cough evaluation.  Depending upon the precise cause(s) and trigger(s) of cough, cough treatment can include:  over-the-counter and prescription medications, diet modifications, and easy and fast do at home voice exercises.  Dr. Mandel Sher recommends cough treatment that balances evidence-based medicine with cutting-edge updates.  As one of the nation's leading Cough Doctors, Center for Cough participates in clinical research trials to evaluate promising new cough treatments.

Results

Cough has a vital function.  Normal cough is a protective mechanism to prevent foreign bodies from entering the respiratory system and lungs.  Chronic Cough, however, generally has no useful function.  It only exists to irritate you and those around you.  Therefore, the goal of effective chronic cough treatment is to normalize your cough, not get rid of it completely. Dr. Mandel Sher's chronic cough patients demonstrate remarkable results.  Over 8 out of 10 patients rapidly experience a measurable decrease in cough frequency and intensity and an overall improvement in life enjoyment.  Please read what some Center for Cough patients say about Dr. Mandel Sher and the Center for Cough experience. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading tag='h4' padding='10' heading='Testimonials' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''][/av_heading] [av_testimonials style='slider' columns='1' interval='5' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content=''] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Trina' subtitle='' link='http://' linktext=''] "This Center for Cough is where I am going for my chronic cough I have had for Years! I had been sleeping in a recliner for years and now I have been able to finally sleep in the bed without feeling like I was choking to death and coughing! Dr. SHER is awesome and he has a great staff of wonderful, friendly, Very Efficient people! I highly recommend him and his cough center! 10 star rating!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Rebecca S.' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "I no longer have the constant coughing or the constant clearing of the throat. Not coughing all the time is a big deal. Dr. Sher has made a big difference in my quality of life." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Vivian' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "I've been fortunate not to have a chronic cough but twice suffered acute coughs that would not go away with various treatments from other physicians. Dr. Sher took care of those coughs both times, quickly and successfully. He is a kind and caring physician with a great mind. I hope he doesn't retire until I'm no longer on this earth!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Richard D' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "I’d been to a number of physicians who had not been able to help me in any way. Within one week, I saw a vast difference. If you just do what your doctor tells you to do, you’ll be fine with Dr. Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Marilyn' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "Dr. Sher has helped us more than once with very thorough explanations and good remedies. We follow his advice and always benefit from his suggestions. He has his patient's good health at the heart of his practice." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Kristen' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "Dr. Sher took the time to make sure that the treatment he was recommending would not only fix the problem but not cause anything else. Dr. Sher is very intelligent and knowledgeable and it really comes across when he deals with a patient." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Marilyn M' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "The repetition was unnerving. He sounded unhealthy. I was worried for my husband, and it was aggravating for me. After one visit with Dr. Mandel Sher at Center for Cough, the change in Tom’s condition was immediate and so satisfying." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Anonymous' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "I highly recommend that anyone who has had a chronic cough must visit Dr. Sher. I have had a cough for over 20 years. We are not sure how or why it all started. Dr. Sher was the first doctor that nailed it for me. I have been to allergists, ear nose and throat, general practitioners, had numerous pictures of my lungs showing no issues..."  View On Ucomparehealthcare.com > [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Peggy' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "After more than 10 years with a cough Dr. Sher helped me lose it. I had been to every kind of medical doctor and alternative therapy imaginable with no results. But now I'm cough free." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Nancy' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "I suffered for nearly a year with a chronic cough. Spent $$$ seeing numerous different specialist who has no answers for me but just kept prescribing different meds. One even suggested pretty drastic sinus surgery. Finally a pulmonologist I saw made an offhand reference to the Center for Cough. I looked it up and made an appointment to see Dr Sher even though he was six hours away from my home. After some tests and an initial consultation, he changed my inhaler medication and I was fully recovered in a week. That was three years ago. I have been cough and medication free since. For me, he was a God-send. I think his success stems from the fact that he is a practicing physician but retains the heart of a researcher who strives to understand the actual underlying nature of his patients' illness and thereby treat them appropriately, unlike the cast majority of doctors today who simply follow the doctor playbook." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Vivian' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "Caring compassionate physician using his expertise every day. He gets rid of the cough! Thank you Dr Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Mickey' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "I went to see Dr.Sher about 4 years ago with a chronic cough I got from radiation in 2001 my cough is awful and it is a very hard cough he has tried so many things and if it didn't work he tell me don't give up on me I still have other things I'm working will he did he is involved in a research program that they have a pill they are testing it is a very big success in Europe and I was the first patient to try it and it works when I was on the pill I did not cough I was so happy as he said from the start don't give up on me and I didn't is only the drug company could work faster I am not on the program now the next survey doesn't start until January of 2017 every time I go and see him I ask him where is my pill I think he is the best I have been to so many doctors since 2001 and they all told me there is nothing they can do and I would have to live with the cough but Dr. Sher never gave up on me he keeps looking for something to help me .i think he is the greatest I even made him a t-shirt that says bow ties are cool it also has a bow tie I embroider it thanks Dr.Sher for everything you are doing for me." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Holly' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "A fantastic doctor! I highly recommend Dr. Mandel Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Welsh' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "I’ve had a chronic cough for over 12 years and have finally found a doctor who has diagnosed it correctly and whose treatment protocol has reduced my coughing spells by at least 50% in just one month. I’ve been approved to participate in one of the cough studies that Dr. Sher is involved in and I’m so excited and hopeful that I’ll continue to do better and better.  Thank you Dr. Sher and your wonderful compassionate staff!!!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Trudy' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "Just finished a trial for a new cough medicine – Great experience and the medicine really helped." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Tony' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "Doc, You are the best!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Judith' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "Having moved from NY to Florida was a huge transition. I have allergies , asthma and chronic lung issues. It was not until I saw Dr. Sher that I had a definitive diagnosis .Dr. Sher is steeped in research , academia and is so current. I have been trying to get a diagnosis since 2009. Office staff kind, efficient and responsive . I feel safe in their care. 10 stars!!!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Alta' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "I had coughed for 9 months straight - coughing to the point of throwing up 8-10 times per day. After 2 general Dr, and an ENT, I went to the Center for Cough and was diagnosed as above (nothing in tests showed up anything). After a dose of steroids, the chlorpheniramine is all I take and I have been cough free since 2 days after my appointment. I am living proof that this works!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Carolyn' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "Dr Sher has been my doctor for years...... He has helped me immensely thru the years. He is thoughtful, intelligent and truly dedicated to his practice and to the desire to get you well and living the best healthy quality that works for you. His office staff is just as dedicated and thoughtful as Dr. Sher. If I could have only one Dr treat me for all my medical conditions it would be Dr. Sher . He has a great team/staff glad I found them!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Cheryl' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "Dr. Mandel and his staff are wonderful. If you have a chronic cough, this is the place." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Linda' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] "I am not surprised !(that Dr. Sher is the ONLY Allergy, Asthma, and Cough Physician Specialist in Pinellas County selected by his physician peers as 2016 Best Doctor) Dr. Sher was the ONLY doctor I've seen to figure out the cause of and what to do about my constant problem with stuffiness and constant coughing. I believe in him 100%! [/av_testimonial_single] [/av_testimonials] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg='']

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1pggjrw'] [av_heading tag='h1' padding='10' heading='Chronic Cough Treatment' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' av_uid='av-63m0ak'][/av_heading] [av_image src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/homepage_image.jpg' attachment='217' attachment_size='full' align='left' styling='' hover='' link='' target='' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation' av_uid='av-1mhj3j0'][/av_image] [/av_one_full] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1lduccc'] [av_heading heading='Precise Identification of Cough’s Cause is the Most Important Step for Effective Cough Treatment' tag='h3' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' av_uid='av-1j002cc'][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1ht953w'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-1gexdcc']

Diagnosis

Not all coughs are created equal.  Most people suffering with Chronic Cough have had this condition for months or years and have tried, but failed, different cough remedies.  For this reason, a diagnosis of Chronic Cough should carefully consider each person's medical narrative and history.  Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough team are cough detectives who listen to each patient carefully and cull vital information from medical records to put-together your cough puzzle.  Center for Cough offers a comprehensive scope of services in one office location to precisely identify the cause(s) and trigger(s) of cough. Dr. Mandel Sher's and Center for Cough's services are all traditional, evidence-based medicine.  Dr. Sher's approach to putting-together your cough puzzle and cough treatment includes innovative components based on Dr. Sher's role in groundbreaking cough drug development and appreciation of lifestyle and behavioral contributions to cough. Dr. Mandel Sher at Center for Cough is specially trained and one of few doctors in the Tampa Bay area using Rhinoscope during an outpatient office visit to examine nasal passages.  Center for Cough also offers FeNO challenge to evaluate the role of asthma and non-asthmatic airway inflammation in cough.

Cough Treatment

Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough's results are remarkable!  Over 85% of patients demonstrate cough reduction and report an overall improvement in feeling good and the quality of their lives.  Many of these patients have seen other doctors for their cough and tried and failed other chronic cough treatments before finally seeing Dr. Sher. Center for Cough recommends cough treatment that targets multiple cough causes and triggers all at once.  This comprehensive approach is more effective in breaking the cough cycle and bringing much-needed and lasting cough relief. A trial-and-error approach to chronic cough treatment used by other doctors delays cough relief, increases frustration, exposes patients to unnecessary risks and side effects from medications that are not targeted to the precise type of cough, and waste money.  Chronic Cough is an under-diagnosed, under-treated, and under-appreciated medical condition in the United States.   Dr. Mandel Sher takes the guesswork out of cough treatment! A comprehensive cough treatment plan is recommended at the end of the initial cough evaluation.  Depending upon the precise cause(s) and trigger(s) of cough, cough treatment can include:  over-the-counter and prescription medications, diet modifications, and easy and fast do at home voice exercises.  Dr. Mandel Sher recommends cough treatment that balances evidence-based medicine with cutting-edge updates.  As one of the nation's leading Cough Doctors, Center for Cough participates in clinical research trials to evaluate promising new cough treatments.

Results

Cough has a vital function.  Normal cough is a protective mechanism to prevent foreign bodies from entering the respiratory system and lungs.  Chronic Cough, however, generally has no useful function.  It only exists to irritate you and those around you.  Therefore, the goal of effective chronic cough treatment is to normalize your cough, not get rid of it completely. Dr. Mandel Sher's chronic cough patients demonstrate remarkable results.  Over 8 out of 10 patients rapidly experience a measurable decrease in cough frequency and intensity and an overall improvement in life enjoyment.  Please read what some Center for Cough patients say about Dr. Mandel Sher and the Center for Cough experience. [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Anonymous' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-ym4iy4'] "I highly recommend that anyone who has had a chronic cough must visit Dr. Sher. I have had a cough for over 20 years. We are not sure how or why it all started. Dr. Sher was the first doctor that nailed it for me. I have been to allergists, ear nose and throat, general practitioners, had numerous pictures of my lungs showing no issues..."  View On Ucomparehealthcare.com > [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Peggy' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-37wq58'] "After more than 10 years with a cough Dr. Sher helped me lose it. I had been to every kind of medical doctor and alternative therapy imaginable with no results. But now I'm cough free." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Nancy' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-vau46k'] "I suffered for nearly a year with a chronic cough. Spent $$$ seeing numerous different specialist who has no answers for me but just kept prescribing different meds. One even suggested pretty drastic sinus surgery. Finally a pulmonologist I saw made an offhand reference to the Center for Cough. I looked it up and made an appointment to see Dr Sher even though he was six hours away from my home. After some tests and an initial consultation, he changed my inhaler medication and I was fully recovered in a week. That was three years ago. I have been cough and medication free since. For me, he was a God-send. I think his success stems from the fact that he is a practicing physician but retains the heart of a researcher who strives to understand the actual underlying nature of his patients' illness and thereby treat them appropriately, unlike the cast majority of doctors today who simply follow the doctor playbook." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Vivian' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-tmx1v0'] "Caring compassionate physician using his expertise every day. He gets rid of the cough! Thank you Dr Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Mickey' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-r19cos'] "I went to see Dr.Sher about 4 years ago with a chronic cough I got from radiation in 2001 my cough is awful and it is a very hard cough he has tried so many things and if it didn't work he tell me don't give up on me I still have other things I'm working will he did he is involved in a research program that they have a pill they are testing it is a very big success in Europe and I was the first patient to try it and it works when I was on the pill I did not cough I was so happy as he said from the start don't give up on me and I didn't is only the drug company could work faster I am not on the program now the next survey doesn't start until January of 2017 every time I go and see him I ask him where is my pill I think he is the best I have been to so many doctors since 2001 and they all told me there is nothing they can do and I would have to live with the cough but Dr. Sher never gave up on me he keeps looking for something to help me .i think he is the greatest I even made him a t-shirt that says bow ties are cool it also has a bow tie I embroider it thanks Dr.Sher for everything you are doing for me." I’ve been approved to participate in one of the cough studies that Dr. Sher is involved in and I’m so excited and hopeful that I’ll continue to do better and better.  Thank you Dr. Sher and your wonderful compassionate staff!!!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Alta' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-1s9l4s'] "I had coughed for 9 months straight - coughing to the point of throwing up 8-10 times per day. item.title: Insurance Information & FAQ
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_heading tag='h2' padding='20' heading='Insurance Information & FAQ' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' av_uid='av-v98ofi'][/av_heading] [av_one_half first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-t0vdha'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-rii2im']

Your Peace and Quiet is Affordable

Center for Cough services are covered by Medicare and private insurance. We accept most insurance types and Dr. Sher is a listed preferred provider with most companies. After your initial call to us, we will be able to provide you with an estimate of your insurance benefits and what your out-of-pocket cost may be. At Center for Cough we believe that cost should not be a barrier to seeking treatment. Our team will work with you to reduce obstacles that may be delaying your treatment. We are happy to submit your insurance, Medicare and secondary or supplemental claims. For your convenience, Center for Cough accepts most credit cards. Call TODAYto speak with a team member. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_half] [av_one_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-pxsj5a'] [av_heading heading='New Patients' tag='h3' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' av_uid='av-o8jgfi'][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-muagz2'] Please help us to prepare for your visit and save time upon your arrival by printing out and completing the patient forms in advance of your appointment.  Once you make your appointment, a Center for Cough team member will let you know which of the numbered forms listed below will be needed for your visit. item.title: Contact -Old
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading heading='Contact Center For Cough' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Tampa Bay Area Cough Treatment Center Location

[/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Center for Cough, located in the Tampa Bay area, provides cough treatment that has demonstrated measurable success in 8 out of 10 patients - including patients who are still coughing after seeing other doctors and trying other cough treatments. To have your cough evaluated and begin cough treatment, please call our office to set up an appointment. Dr. Sher's services are covered by Medicare and major insurance companies. Speak to a team leader to take the steps that will make your visit efficient and worry-free. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_one_third first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Contact Info

[av_font_icon icon='ue854' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='35px' position='left' color=''][/av_font_icon]PHONE: (727) 393-8067 or  1-888-MDCOUGH (632-6844) FAX: (727) 397-4459 Mandel Sher, M.D.,          Diane Canavan Founder                                  Practice Director ADDRESS: 11200 Seminole Blvd. | Suite 310 | Largo, FL 33778 [/av_textblock] [/av_one_third][av_one_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_codeblock wrapper_element='' wrapper_element_attributes='' escape_html='' deactivate_shortcode='' deactivate_wrapper=''][/av_codeblock] [/av_one_third][av_one_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='']

Telephone Hours

Monday: 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. Tuesday: 9:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m. Wednesday & Thursday: 7:30 a.m.- 4:30 p.m. Friday: 8:30 a.m. - noon The office telephone is answered 24/7.  Our patients are our highest priority.  If you are calling to schedule an appointment while a Center for Cough team leader is giving another patient undivided attention, please request a callback by completing the brief form on the next page.  Thank You. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_third][av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Dr. Sher's patients come from places throughout the United States to have their cough evaluated and treated. The Largo, Florida office location is centrally located and easy to get-to by major highways and Tampa International and St. Pete-Clearwater International airports. Our Florida patients come from neighboring communities in the Tampa Bay area:  Brandon, Bradenton, Clearwater, Ft. Myers, Lakeland, Naples, New Port Richey, Orlando, Port Charlotte, Sarasota, and Tampa. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_one_third first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading heading='New patients' tag='h3' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] Please help us to prepare for your visit and save time upon your arrival by printing out and completing the patient forms in advance of your appointment.  Once you make your appointment, a Center for Cough team member will let you know which of the numbered forms listed below will be needed for your visit. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_third][av_one_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading heading='Patient Forms' tag='h3' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color=''] [av_font_icon icon='ue812' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='15px' position='left' color=''][/av_font_icon]1. Your Peace and Quiet is Affordable

Center for Cough services are covered by Medicare and private insurance. We accept most insurance types and Dr. Sher is a listed preferred provider with most companies. After your initial call to us, we will be able to provide you with an estimate of your insurance benefits and what your out-of-pocket cost may be. At Center for Cough we believe that cost should not be a barrier to seeking treatment. Our team will work with you to reduce obstacles that may be delaying your treatment. We are happy to submit your insurance, Medicare and secondary or supplemental claims. For your convenience, Center for Cough accepts most credit cards. Call TODAYto speak with a team member. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_half][av_one_half min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display=''] [av_toggle_container initial='0' mode='accordion' sort=''] [av_toggle title='Toggle 1' tags=''] [av_toggle title='Toggle 2' tags=''] [/av_toggle_container] [av_button label='View Center For Cough FAQ Page' link='page,1811' link_target='' size='large' position='center' icon_select='yes' icon='ue811' font='entypo-fontello' color='theme-color' custom_bg='#444444' custom_font='#ffffff'] [/av_one_half]

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1x63ubk'] [av_heading heading='Contact Center For Cough' tag='h2' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' av_uid='av-1vco380'][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-1spxdq8']

Tampa Bay Area Cough Treatment Center Location

[/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1s3umm8'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-1pgp4ps'] Center for Cough, located in the Tampa Bay area, provides cough treatment that has demonstrated measurable success in 8 out of 10 patients - including patients who are still coughing after seeing other doctors and trying other cough treatments. To have your cough evaluated and begin cough treatment, please call our office to set up an appointment. Dr. Sher's services are covered by Medicare and major insurance companies. Speak to a team leader to take the steps that will make your visit efficient and worry-free. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_one_third first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1oajn34'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-1mgbdr4']

Contact Info

[av_font_icon icon='ue854' font='entypo-fontello' style='' caption='' link='' linktarget='' size='35px' position='left' color='' av_uid='av-1ltdrj4'][/av_font_icon]PHONE: (727) 393-8067 or  1-888-MDCOUGH (632-6844) FAX: (727) 397-4459 Mandel Sher, M.D.,          Diane Canavan Founder                                  Practice Director ADDRESS: 11200 Seminole Blvd. | Suite 310 | Largo, FL 33778 [/av_textblock] [/av_one_third][av_one_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1jojk74'] [av_codeblock wrapper_element='' wrapper_element_attributes='' escape_html='' deactivate_shortcode='' deactivate_wrapper='' av_uid='av-1h6a8w0'][/av_codeblock] [/av_one_third][av_one_third min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1fklrsw'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-1ed6exs']

Telephone Hours

Monday: 8:00 a.m. - 4:30 p.m. Tuesday: 9:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m. Wednesday & Thursday: 7:30 a.m.- 4:30 p.m. Friday: 8:30 a.m. - noon The office telephone is answered 24/7.  Our patients are our highest priority.  If you are calling to schedule an appointment while a Center for Cough team leader is giving another patient undivided attention, please request a callback by completing the brief form on the next page.  Thank You. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_third][av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1dld99s'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-1by29pc'] Dr. Sher's patients come from places throughout the United States to have their cough evaluated and treated. The Largo, Florida office location is centrally located and easy to get-to by major highways and Tampa International and St. Pete-Clearwater International airports. Our Florida patients come from neighboring communities in the Tampa Bay area:  Brandon, Bradenton, Clearwater, Ft. Myers, Lakeland, Naples, New Port Richey, Orlando, Port Charlotte, Sarasota, and Tampa. [/av_textblock] [/av_one_full][av_one_third first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1a8g4b4'] [av_heading heading='New patients' tag='h3' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' av_uid='av-17ljmhc'][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av_uid='av-15lj15c'] Please help us to prepare for your visit and save time upon your arrival by printing out and completing the patient forms in advance of your appointment.  Once you make your appointment, a Center for Cough team member will let you know which of the numbered forms listed below will be needed for your visit.
