item.title: Patient-Success-Stories
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-1jymn9x'] [av_heading heading='Patient Sucess Stories' tag='h2' link_apply='' link='' link_target='' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' margin='' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' custom_class='' id='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size=''][/av_heading] [av_heading heading='Hear What Dr. Sher’s Patients Are Saying' tag='h3' link_apply='' link='' link_target='' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' margin='' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' custom_class='' id='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-1dxo2px'] Some Center for Cough patients have shared their experience with the Center for Cough team. Here is what they had to say. More reviews can be found at Healthgrades.com. [/av_textblock] [av_testimonials style='grid' columns='2' grid_style='av-minimal-grid-style' interval='5' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' av_uid='av-1d1wllh' id='' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Trina' subtitle='' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-1bsq87p'] "This Center for Cough is where I am going for my chronic cough I have had for Years! I had been sleeping in a recliner for years and now I have been able to finally sleep in the bed without feeling like I was choking to death and coughing! Dr. SHER is awesome and he has a great staff of wonderful, friendly, Very Efficient people! I highly recommend him and his cough center! 10 star rating!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Rebecca S.' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-19gl1ad'] "I no longer have the constant coughing or the constant clearing of the throat. Not coughing all the time is a big deal. Dr. Sher has made a big difference in my quality of life." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Richard D.' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-fmp45'] "I’d been to a number of physicians who had not been able to help me in any way. Within one week, I saw a vast difference. If you just do what your doctor tells you to do, you’ll be fine with Dr. Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Vivian' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-15vj479'] "I've been fortunate not to have a chronic cough but twice suffered acute coughs that would not go away with various treatments from other physicians. Dr. Sher took care of those coughs both times, quickly and successfully. He is a kind and caring physician with a great mind. I hope he doesn't retire until I'm no longer on this earth!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Marilyn' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-153uoad'] "Dr. Sher has helped us more than once with very thorough explanations and good remedies. We follow his advice and always benefit from his suggestions. He has his patient's good health at the heart of his practice." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Kristen' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-3w3kud'] "Dr. Sher took the time to make sure that the treatment he was recommending would not only fix the problem but not cause anthing else. Dr. Sher is very intelligent and knowledgeable and it really comes across when he deals with a patient." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Anonymous' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-2nyxhh'] "I highly recommend that anyone who has had a chronic cough must visit Dr. Sher. I have had a cough for over 20 years. We are not sure how or why it all started. Dr. Sher was the first doctor that nailed it for me. I have been to allergists, ear nose and throat, general practitioners, had numerous pictures of my lungs showing no issues..."  View On Ucomparehealthcare.com > [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Peggy S.' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-zb43lh'] "After more than 10 years with a cough Dr. Sher helped me lose it. I had been to every kind of medical doctor and alternative therapy imaginable with no results. But now I'm cough free." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Nancy' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-22vdx'] "I suffered for nearly a year with a chronic cough. Spent $$$ seeing numerous different specialist who has no answers for me but just kept prescribing different meds. One even suggested pretty drastic sinus surgery. Finally a pulmonologist I saw made an offhand reference to the Center for Cough. I looked it up and made an appointment to see Dr Sher even though he was six hours away from my home. After some tests and an initial consultation, he changed my inhaler medication and I was fully recovered in a week. That was three years ago. I have been cough and medication free since. For me, he was a God-send. I think his success stems from the fact that he is a practicing physician but retains the heart of a researcher who strives to understand the actual underlying nature of his patients' illness and thereby treat them appropriately, unlike the cast majority of doctors today who simply follow the doctor playbook." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Mickey' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-392qvp'] "I went to see Dr.Sher about 4 years ago with a chronic cough I got from radiation in 2001 my cough is awful and it is a very hard cough he has tried so many things and if it didn't work he tell me don't give up on me I still have other things I'm working will he did he is involved in a research program that they have a pill they are testing it is a very big success in Europe and I was the first patient to try it and it works when I was on the pill I did not cough I was so happy as he said from the start don't give up on me and I didn't is only the drug company could work faster I am not on the program now the next survey doesn't start until January of 2017 every time I go and see him I ask him where is my pill I think he is the best I have been to so many doctors since 2001 and they all told me there is nothing they can do and I would have to live with the cough but Dr. Sher never gave up on me he keeps looking for something to help me .i think he is the greatest I even made him a t-shirt that says bow ties are cool it also has a bow tie I embroider it thanks Dr.Sher for everything you are doing for me." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Welch' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-u3sp91'] "I’ve had a chronic cough for over 12 years and have finally found a doctor who has diagnosed it correctly and whose treatment protocol has reduced my coughing spells by at least 50% in just one month. I’ve been approved to participate in one of the cough studies that Dr. Sher is involved in and I’m so excited and hopeful that I’ll continue to do better and better.  Thank you Dr. Sher and your wonderful compassionate staff!!!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Judith' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-sxms6t'] "Having moved from NY to Florida was a huge transition. I have allergies , asthma and chronic lung issues. It was not until I saw Dr. Sher that I had a definitive diagnosis .Dr. Sher is steeped in research , academia and is so current. I have been trying to get a diagnosis since 2009. Office staff kind, efficient and responsive . I feel safe in their care. 10 stars!!!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Alta' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-rhjzwl'] "I had coughed for 9 months straight - coughing to the point of throwing up 8-10 times per day. After 2 general Dr, and an ENT, I went to the Center for Cough and was diagnosed as above (nothing in tests showed up anything). After a dose of steroids, the chlorpheniramine is all I take and I have been cough free since 2 days after my appointment. I am living proof that this works!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Carolyn' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-9dn9h'] "Dr Sher has been my doctor for years...... He has helped me immensely thru the years. He is thoughtful, intelligent and truly dedicated to his practice and to the desire to get you well and living the best healthy quality that works for you. His office staff is just as dedicated and thoughtful as Dr. Sher. If I could have only one Dr treat me for all my medical conditions it would be Dr. Sher . He has a great team/staff glad I found them!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Holly' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-ojo9ol'] "A fantastic doctor! I highly recommend Dr. Mandel Sher." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Cheryl' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-myr0j9'] "Dr. Mandel and his staff are wonderful. If you have a chronic cough, this is the place." I believe in him 100%! [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Marilyn M.' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-ifnyid'] "The repetition was unnerving. [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Earl' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-bjjcfp'] "After suffering for months with cough seizures a friend suggested Dr. Sher at The Center for Cough. The appointment easy to schedule, the staff very friendly and attentive. Dr. Sher himself is thorough and conscientious and extremely professional. BTW, his office staff is very friendly and helpful, especially his wonderful wife." I would highly recommend Dr. Sher to anyone who has a long lasting cough....Love this doctor." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Dayna' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-7lggmt'] "I have never been so impressed with a doctor as I was with Dr. Sher at the Center for Cough. The time he spent and the information he shared and also explaining everything was incredible. I highly recommend Dr. Sher and the Center for Cough." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Sharon' subtitle='He Saved My Life' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-68hcet']

"5 years ago I was in his office for a routine allergy shot. Dr. Sher noticed a persistent cough, treated me with steroids, and when that did not help, he ordered an Xray. He saw a very small sot on my lung and alerted my personal physician to get an MRI. He called from his cell phone at dinner time to report the results. It was diagnosed as cancer. After surgery, I am clear of cancer for 5 years now, and ever so thankful to Dr. Sher."

[/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Sue' subtitle='' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-4u3n79'] "Dr. Sher and his office staff were wonderful. ' subtitle='Dr. Sher Saved My Lilfe!' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-29ddqd'] "I am an RN of 25 years and have had a cough for my entire life. For 3 years it was severe. I went to countless specialists & had every test available, all offering ZERO answers. I was on 12 prescription meds with ZERO improvement. Dr. Sher has saved my life! I no longer need a laundry list of meds or to spend every day off in a doctor’s office. I finally have a normal life without a hacking cough, exhaustion, embarrassment & constant disruption to everyone around me. Everyone there is great!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name=' Dr. Julie S. ' subtitle='Fellow Physician & Patient’ Thank You' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-gm9z9'] "As a fellow physician and his patient, I could not speak more highly of him. Despite multiple specialists who could not diagnose my debilitating cough , he did in moments. I was extremely impressed by him, his office staff and their courtesy and kindness. Thank you!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Shari' subtitle='Thank You, Thank You, Thank You' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-2pmxz9']
"After coughing for 37 years and no help from several specialists Dr. Sher has decreased my cough by 95%. Thank you, Thank you, Thank you. Now I can start to live a normal life again. Hands Down, if you have a cough Dr. Sher is the man to see."
[/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Bobbe' subtitle='No Nonsense Doctor Who Is Very Knowledgeable' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-28ylbp'] "After 33 radiation treatments for laryngeal cancer in 2016, the tissue damage inside caused me to have a terrible cough. It was similar to what you would have during a bad cold, only it was much worse and it went on for months. Dr Sher really helped me to find ways to try to fight through it and get some control over it. Eventually my tissues healed and that cough subsided. For years it was thought that I had some type of asthma because of a nagging cough and chest congestion. Dr Sher did some testing and we experimented with my med doses and have discovered that I DO NOT have asthma and my cough source is something else entirely. Now I don't require those expensive asthma drugs anymore. He is a no nonsense doctor who is very knowledgeable!" - Bobbe, March 2019 [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Nancy' subtitle='This Man Knows His $&!# !' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-4a9p1h'] "I had a chronic cough that wreaked havoc on my life for 10 months. After numerous unnecessary and ineffective at best procedures and prescriptions, I found Dr. Sher. He changed my medicine and I was better in days. That was 6 years ago and the cough never returned. [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Amanda' subtitle='He Will Always Be One of My Favorite Doctors' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-azqb9'] "I'm so glad Dr Sher is helping to train the next generation of doctors! He will always be one of my favorite doctors. I recommend him anytime someone had allergies, a cough, etc." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Heather' subtitle='AMAZING!' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-1xun6d'] Dr. Sher and his team are amazing! [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='MB' subtitle='' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-33smqt'] "As a practicing physician, he and his staff practice high quality medicine. It's reassuring that the staff, office and Dr, Sher addressed my medical concerns professionally and more importantly, resolved my cough and ear ache" - MB, July 2019 [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='O.J.' subtitle='' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-24qud1']
Most people do not know there is a cough specialist. I saw multiple doctors for 1 year before I was finally given Dr Sher's information. I saw Dr Sher and his nurse for one visit, was told what I had to do which was simply hydrating and special exercises and the cough that I had had for 1 year was gone in one day. Absolutely unbelievable and very much appreciated. I would recommend them to anyone and everyone. O.J., June 2020
[/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Anne O.' subtitle='He is an amazing diagnostician' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-4exqf9'] "I have had a chronic cough for over 16 years and had not been able to find a reason or relief. At our first visit he listened and we developed a plan which had had a major impact on my cough. He asks many question, and is an amazing diagnostician. I am thankful to have his followup and continued support in controlling my symptoms. Thank you Dr Sher!!" Anne O., September 2020 [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Stephanie M.' subtitle='He works magic, pure and simple' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-220gp1'] "Dr. Sher and his office personnel are simply the best. Wonderful bedside manner, highly personable, and soooo caring. This is a doctor who truly cares about your well-being and wants you to achieve excellent results. The office staff are friendly, as well, and know what they are doing. Communication between the doctor and office personnel is terrific, too. I've never had a single issue with any of them, and they offer virtual appointments now, too. I LOVE that, because it means I don't have to drive an hour or more, depending on traffic, for a brief follow-up visit. Also, Dr. Sher successfully eliminated a mysterious cough I'd had for eight years, and did so after only two visits. I'd had all the tests with all the specialists, and no one could figure it out, but Dr. Sher DID. I would recommend him to anyone. He works magic, pure and simple." Stephanie M., September 2020 [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Chris' subtitle='Truly Amazing!' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-4tcmz9']
"When I visited Dr. Sher I was coughing constantly and had been for a long time. In a short period of time he treated my cough and reduced it to 1 or 2 mild coughs a day. Truly amazing!!!"
[/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Georgia' subtitle='You Have Given Me My Life Back' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-395bh1'] "I sought out Dr. Sher after 15 months of debilitating, constant cough. I had been undergoing extensive treatments for lung cancer including two chest surgeries and multiple procedures as well as chemotherapy. My cancer was gone but I had a cough that just wouldn't go away. I had sought answers from my oncologist, two surgeons, pulmonologist, internal medicine physician , allergist and ENT. No one had any answers for me. Finally I was referred to Dr. Sher and the Center for Cough and in one 45 minute telemedicine Zoom meeting with Dr. Sher, my problem was diagnosed and a treatment plan put in place. With a few changes to my lifestyle, including medicine and exercises, my coughing is 80% gone. I am able to sleep, eat, talk and live my life without the constant coughing. Thank you Dr. Sher. You have given me my life back. If you have a cough that won't go away--make an appointment to see Dr. Sher today. You won't regret it." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='D.T.' subtitle='I Have Complete Trust in His Care' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-2ihyfp']
"Dr. Sher has spent the time explaining everything and I have complete trust in his care. The office staff, nurses and techs are what other physician offices should aspire to be. They are great!"
[/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Barbara' subtitle='Dr. Sher Gets to Bottom of Medical Problems Which Frustrated Many Other Physicians' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-2eiked'] "Dr. Sher is a very through physician. He is eager to answer questions. He gets to the bottom of medical problems which frustrated many other physicians." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='February 19, 2021' subtitle='Dr. Mandel Sher Saved My Husband’s Life' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-2ewpnp'] "The doctor saved my husband's life. He went in because of a cough. The doctor insisted on a chest x-ray which revealed a black spot. Upon further investigation we found he had fungal pneumonia. Because we caught this early he was treated and healed. This would probably have gone unnoticed and without treatment he might have died.
What went well:
  • Appointment scheduling
  • Office environment
  • Staff friendliness
  • Wait times
  • Appointment wasn't rushed
  • Listened & answered questions
  • Explained conditions well
  • Trusted the provider's decisions"
[/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='K. B.' subtitle='"Dr. Sher Changed My Life"' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-303yid'] "Dr. Sher changed my life dramatically and because of that I highly recommend his practice. I had literally had a cough for more than 30 years and frequently could not have a conversation due to it. Because my vocation moved my family and me to several cities, I have seen countless doctors: Primary Care Doctors, allergists, pulmonologists, gastroenterologists, chiropractors, holistic doctors and even acupuncturists. I tried countless medications and injections. And then there were the countless home remedies that had cured everyone’s uncle from his cough. Even with trying all of those attempts, I I still had the cough. Then I was recommend to and went to see Dr. Sher. He was able to discover a treatment plan and my cough, for the first time in more than 30 years, went away. However, I then had a liver transplant and following it, my cough came back. Once again, Dr. Sher was able to help it go away. Then I had COVID and it returned. But once again, Dr. Sher was able to treat it and it went away. You can understand why I write that Dr. Sher changed my life. In addition, I found his office staff very personable and extremely helpful. I have been able to see the doctor in person as well as Tele-a- visits. Visit Dr. Sher’s office and hopefully you will be able to state that Dr. Sher changed your life as he did mine." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Randi' subtitle='Dr. Sher is wonderful, and you will get relief' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-2l71t1'] "Dr. Sher has helped me tremendously. He explained why I am experiencing the symptoms and has helped me alleviate them. But the best part is that he accepts insurance. I went to a doctor in New York a few years ago when the problem began and it cost me over $5,000 out of pocket. I wish I would have known about Dr. Sher then. If you are experiencing a chronic cough that no other doctor can explain, definitely see Dr. Sher. He is wonderful, and you will get relief." (May 2021) [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Celia R.' subtitle='He is a Miracle Worker! Thank you Dr. Sher!' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-2uuwyd'] "I’ve been coughing for about 10 years and I admit that when I was referred to Dr. Sher I was very skeptical because nothing has helped my chronic cough and throat clearing. Dr. Sher diagnosed me, changed my medication and gave me exercises to do which have made a tremendous difference. The frequency and severity of the cough and throat clearing dramatically decreased after about three days, and I continue to improve. I used to be hesitant about social interactions, and even avoided them at times because the cough was disruptive and embarrassing, but no longer! He is a miracle worker! Thank you Dr. Sher!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Gail K.' subtitle='I am SO grateful my ENT referred me to Dr. Sher. He is an amazing doctor.' link='http://' linktext=''] "100% recommend Dr. Sher. Unlike other doctors, he was able to get to the root of my problem that has plagued me for over 2 years.  Prior to my visit, Dr. Sher had thoroughly reviewed all my historical records that I mailed to him. At my first visit, he asked a lot of questions and listened to my issues and concerns. Dr. Sher conveys genuine concern and commits himself to diagnosing the problem . . . he ultimately did!
Dr. Sher speaks on a level that a non-medical person can understand. His staff is efficient and pleasant.
I am SO grateful my ENT referred me to Dr. Sher. He is an amazing doctor."
[/av_testimonial_single] [/av_testimonials] [/av_one_full]

Dr. Sher is very intelligent and knowledgeable and it really comes across when he deals with a patient." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Anonymous' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-2nyxhh'] "I highly recommend that anyone who has had a chronic cough must visit Dr. Sher. I have had a cough for over 20 years. We are not sure how or why it all started. Dr. Sher was the first doctor that nailed it for me. I have been to allergists, ear nose and throat, general practitioners, had numerous pictures of my lungs showing no issues..."  View On Ucomparehealthcare.com > [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Peggy S.' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-zb43lh'] "After more than 10 years with a cough Dr. Sher helped me lose it. I had been to every kind of medical doctor and alternative therapy imaginable with no results. But now I'm cough free." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Nancy' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-22vdx'] "I suffered for nearly a year with a chronic cough. Spent $$$ seeing numerous different specialist who has no answers for me but just kept prescribing different meds. One even suggested pretty drastic sinus surgery. Finally a pulmonologist I saw made an offhand reference to the Center for Cough. I looked it up and made an appointment to see Dr Sher even though he was six hours away from my home. After some tests and an initial consultation, he changed my inhaler medication and I was fully recovered in a week. That was three years ago. I have been cough and medication free since. For me, he was a God-send. I think his success stems from the fact that he is a practicing physician but retains the heart of a researcher who strives to understand the actual underlying nature of his patients' illness and thereby treat them appropriately, unlike the cast majority of doctors today who simply follow the doctor playbook." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Mickey' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-392qvp'] "I went to see Dr.Sher about 4 years ago with a chronic cough I got from radiation in 2001 my cough is awful and it is a very hard cough he has tried so many things and if it didn't work he tell me don't give up on me I still have other things I'm working will he did he is involved in a research program that they have a pill they are testing it is a very big success in Europe and I was the first patient to try it and it works when I was on the pill I did not cough I was so happy as he said from the start don't give up on me and I didn't is only the drug company could work faster I am not on the program now the next survey doesn't start until January of 2017 every time I go and see him I ask him where is my pill I think he is the best I have been to so many doctors since 2001 and they all told me there is nothing they can do and I would have to live with the cough but Dr. Sher never gave up on me he keeps looking for something to help me .i think he is the greatest I even made him a t-shirt that says bow ties are cool it also has a bow tie I embroider it thanks Dr.Sher for everything you are doing for me." [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Welch' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-u3sp91'] "I’ve had a chronic cough for over 12 years and have finally found a doctor who has diagnosed it correctly and whose treatment protocol has reduced my coughing spells by at least 50% in just one month. I’ve been approved to participate in one of the cough studies that Dr. Sher is involved in and I’m so excited and hopeful that I’ll continue to do better and better.  Thank you Dr. Sher and your wonderful compassionate staff!!!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Judith' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-sxms6t'] "Having moved from NY to Florida was a huge transition. I have allergies , asthma and chronic lung issues. It was not until I saw Dr. Sher that I had a definitive diagnosis .Dr. Sher is steeped in research , academia and is so current. I have been trying to get a diagnosis since 2009. Office staff kind, efficient and responsive . I feel safe in their care. 10 stars!!!" [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Alta' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-rhjzwl'] "I had coughed for 9 months straight - coughing to the point of throwing up 8-10 times per day. After 2 general Dr, and an ENT, I went to the Center for Cough and was diagnosed as above (nothing in tests showed up anything). item.title: What's Making Me Cough?
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
Sequence of Actions in the Cough Reflex Pathway Resulting in Cough

The chronic cougher tends to have an increased urge to cough. It can be described as a tickle in the back of the throat. Sometimes it can be a feeling that something is stuck there. Often, there is a feeling of post nasal drip, but rarely any is produced. A hypersensitive or heightened cough reflex requires less stimuli, such as nasal secretions, airborne irritants, acid or gastroesophageal reflux, to trigger a chronic cough. What creates these feelings?
  • Cough receptors in the upper airway (nose), larynx (voice box), lung, and esophagus are activated by direct irritation such as throat infection, post nasal drip or gastric acid (which has contact with the receptors in the larynx/voice box)
  • The receptors send a signal to the cough center in the lower brain area
  • The cough center then decides if there is enough stimulus to set off a cough
  • The cough center becomes hyperactive by repeated stimulation from the peripheral cough receptors
  • The cough center is also influenced by higher brain function which can result in a voluntary and habit cough
  • Stimulation of the upper airway, esophagus, and lung can heighten or sensitize the cough reflex without actually triggering off a cough. For example, acid or even food entering the esophagus from the stomach can send signals to the cough center to become more sensitive or irritable. Allergic nasal symptoms also send signals to the cough center and increase sensitivity.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The common characteristics of a chronic cough and what affects the cough reflex path way to make you cough.

item.title: Could You be Coughing from Cough Variant Asthma?
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded: Diagnosing the cause(s) and trigger(s) of Chronic Cough can be like splitting hairs.  In this blog post, cough variant asthma is discussed.  Sometimes, a diagnosis of asthma is ruled in or ruled out on the basis of classic asthma symptoms.  Cough variant asthma acts differently than asthma and presents with different symptoms. The first step toward cough treatment is precise diagnosis.  Dr. Mandel Sher, Medical Director and Founder of Center for Cough, is a Cough Doctor.  He offers patients a comprehensive diagnostic and cough treatment approach. Cough asthma– Chronic Cough as the only sign of asthma is often referred to as cough variant asthma. It is usually a dry, hacking cough that may worsen following exercise and cold air exposure. It may not be associated with other asthma symptoms such as wheezing, chest tightness or shortness of breath. Pulmonary function tests may be normal or reveal a mild obstructive pattern. Like other asthmatics, cough asthma has reversible airway obstruction. Tests of lung inflammation, involving allergic type cells called eosinophils, such as expired nitric oxide, may be positive. Diagnosis relies on response to asthma medications such as oral or inhaled corticosteroids, bronchodilators and leukotriene inhibitors. Non-asthmatic eosinophilic bronchitis– Chronic cough triggered by eosinophil lung inflammation is similar to asthma but without reversible airways that are observed in asthma. Symptoms are similar to cough asthma, have increased tests of eosinophilic inflammation such as nitric oxide, respond to corticosteroid therapy, but will have normal lung function test and not respond to bronchodilators.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Learn More About Cough Triggers: Asthma & Lung Inflmmation
Cough variant asthma may not have asthma symptoms. Dr. Mandel Sher precisely diagnoses asthma, cough asthma or lung inflammation in your Chronic Cough.

item.title: Cough Hypersensitivity Syndrome for Accurate Diagnosis and Treatment of Chronic Cough
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded: Dr. Sher and Center for Cough believe that Cough Hypersensitivity Syndrome is the approach to accurately diagnosing and effectively treating chronic cough. A relevant discussion was presented by Eva Millgvist, M.D., Ph.D. in "The Problems of Treating Unexplained Chronic Cough" in the March 2016 issue of the journal Chest.  The article reports that chronic cough, similar to chronic pain and itch, is neurogenic mediated.  This finding supports Center for Cough's thesis that patients with chronic cough are "hot wired" to cough, and treatment may include  behavioral (speech therapy) and pharmacologic (chlorpeneramine extendtabs and gabapentin) to "cool down" the cough.

item.title: World Allergy Week is April 4-10, 2016
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
The World Allergy Organization (WAO) was established in 1951 as an international organization of allergology and clinical immunology societies from around the world. WAO provides educational outreach programs, symposia and lectureships in nearly 100 countries around the globe. Dr. Mandel Sher is a Co-Editor of the World Allergy Organization on-line journal.
Allergies can be a trigger to a hypersensitive cough reflex and produce chronic cough. Dr. Sher established Center for Cough in 2009 after treating patients with chronic cough in Sher Allergy Specialists since 1984.

item.title: Newsmaker: Dr. Mandel Sher in the News!
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
Inbox
 x
ox 13 News segment featuring Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough patient, Ms. Joan Meier, aired on Monday, July 25th, during the 10 P.M. hour.  Please click on the link to view. http://www.fox13news.com/news/local-news/181884481-story
Ms. Meier told Fox 13's Dr. Joette Giovinco that her cough began eight years ago.  "It was uncontrollable, I could not manage the cough.  There was nothing that helped and it was one of those coughs that was deep and intense and sounds like someone is very ill." Ms. Meier reported that the hacking cough was so bad, she found it hard to leave her house.  Each coughing episode left Joan exhausted and interrupted her sleep.  Six years, four doctors, and a variety of treatments didn't help.  That is until Joan saw Dr. Sher. 
Dr. Sher is a Cough Specialist and the nation's leading investigator of a promising new drug for persistent cough.  Dr. Sher explained: "Cough has an unmet need for therapy. We do not have an optimal cough drug.  Either they cause a significant amount of side effects or they don't work so well.  The last time the Food and Drug Administration approved a new cough drug was in 1958." Dr. Sher added that researchers are focusing on the tiny nerves lining the back of the throat and respiratory track as a cause of Chronic Cough.  The nerves were discovered decades ago and were largely ignored. "This is actually picking up a rock and seeing something that has been sitting there and starting to investigate," Dr. Sher said. Dr. Sher believes that some people are "hard-wired and hot-wired" to cough.  A promising new drug, AF-219, targets these nerve endings.Joan participated in a 12-week clinical trial evaluating the effectiveness of AF-219. During the trial, Joan experienced a decreased sense of taste but it has since returned.  Joan says: " What Dr. Sher's treatment, plus the clinical trial medicine, has given me is the ability to have cough that's manageable.  Whether my apple pie tastes the same or not, when I compare that with the ability to be in... my church service or at Disney, I'd rather take the medication."
 

Drug could give relief for persistent cough

 

Mark Aleman <mark@venturoutconsulting.com>
12:00 AM (10 hours ago)
to me
Hello Karen,
Brad and I looked over your Facebook campaign and our overall impression is great. The picture and title provided by the  link are captivating enough to make a viewer interested in following through with clicking. The only thing we are curious about is what is your call to action? I would suggest including a brief sentence along the lines of, “schedule and appointment today with Dr. Sher and begin your cough treatment today” followed by a direct link to your appointment setting page on CFC and/or a phone number a view can call to schedule an appointment.
My only other comment is to ask if there is a specific reason as to why you chose to target specifically women? The rest of your target audience seems to be perfect.
Now another route we can take rather than boosting your post is to boost/promote your page as a whole. This does run a bit more expensive (with your current target audience at about 5$ a day you will reach about 480-1300 people daily). The benefit to boosting your page rather than a post is you have a higher probability of a viewer liking your page versus liking a post. Once a viewer likes your page they will then begin to see any future posts you create.
Boosting a post is a more effective marketing strategy when you're looking for an immediate conversion. In this case I believe you would benefit more in the long run from gaining page viewers as a whole rather than attempting to gain an immediate scheduled appointment from a post boost.
I hope this helps.
Best Regards, Mark Aleman Venturout LLC (561)-602-0214

item.title: Inside the Mind of a Chronic Cougher
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded: "I can't get rid of this cough." "If I'm still coughing next week I'll go see a doctor." "I already went to the doctor for this cough and I'm still hacking away." Sound familiar? Is this something you've said or heard a family member or friend say? Dr. Mandel Sher at Center for Cough says that patients who finally come into see him for their nagging cough have usually been thinking about making an appointment for a while. Why do people with a constant cough put-off seeing a Cough Doctor? How can you talk to a coughing family member or friend about your concern and suggest a cough evaluation with Dr. Sher: 727-393-8067? People with a nagging cough may delay seeing Dr. Sher because they are: AFRAID the cough may be a symptom of something really serious like lung cancer or COPD; DEPRESSED because their anxiety about not being able to effectively manage their cough is resulting in SOCIAL ISOLATION; ANXIOUS because their colleagues don't want to work with them because they fear they are sick and contagious; or STRESSED-OUT because their family and friends are worried about how the cough is affecting them. If you have are coughing for at least 8 weeks OR have already seen your primary care physician for a cough and are still coughing, then it's time to see a Cough Doctor, Dr. Mandel Sher: 727-393-8067. Cough that won't go away can be an indication of a serious medical problem. But sometimes, cough is THE problem. Persistent cough should not be ignored. People suffering with Chronic Cough should not learn to live with it. Chronic Cough should be evaluated by Dr. Mandel Sher to identify the precise cause of your unique cough and recommend a cough treatment plan targeted specifically to your cough. As the over-the-counter Robutussin says, "It's Never Just a Cough." Chronic Cough generally does not go away by itself - it needs a cough intervention by a cough expert. Nagging, hacking cough may be associated with a cold, bronchitis, and other irritants that TRIGGER the cough, BUT, it may be CAUSED by a hypersensitive cough reflex. In other words, a person may be HARD-WIRED to cough because the nerve endings at the back of the throat are overly sensitive and irritants ignite a blazing fire and set-off constant coughing. The very good news is that there is a real and lasting solution for Chronic Cough relief. Dr. Mandel Sher is a Cough Doctor. His patients demonstrate remarkably high cough relief and improvement in the overall quality of their lives. All services are Medicare and commercial insurance approved. Dr. Sher and Center for Cough team balance an evidence-based and cutting-edge approach to cough diagnosis and cough treatment. Dr. Sher and Center for Cough team understand the debilitating consequences of Chronic Cough. Call today to see how Dr. Mandel Sher can help you: 727-393-8067.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: People with nagging, constant cough think about seeing a Cough Doctor but often delay out-of FEAR, DEPRESSION, ANXIETY, OR HOPE IT WILL GO AWAY BY ITSELF

item.title: Calling All Coughers! Dr. Sher Is Looking For Participants To Help Evaluate a New Cough Drug
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough are actively enrolling participants in open cough studies. If you, or someone you know, may be interested in joining a cough study, please contact Amy, Center for Cough's Clinical Research Nurse Coordinator at 727-393-8067.  Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough team appreciate participants' help in evaluating new cough medications.  Please read the message below, developed by the study sponsors,  that will give you information about a current cough study called The VOLCANO-2 Study: ____________________________________________________________

The VOLCANO-2 Study

A clinical research study for people with chronic refractory cough

I am writing to tell you that my team at Center For Cough is currently running a clinical research study.  It's called the VOLCANO-2 Study and it is testing an investigational drug for the treatment of chronic refractory cough.  We are looking for men and women who are over 18 years of age who have had chronic refractory cough, or an unexplained cough, fore more than 1 year.  The investigational drug is a tablet, which will be taken once a day. If you decide to join the study, you may be helping us to learn more about this difficult-to-treat condition. The VOLCANO-2 Study will last for approximately 18 weeks, and you will be expected to attend 7 visits at this clinic.  During these visits, we will ask you about your health and carry out study assessments, such as a physical examination and measurement of your vital signs.  On 4 separate days during the study we will ask you to wear an Ambulatory Cough Monitor, which will record how often you cough in a 24-hour period.  You will also be asked to complete a number of questionnaires which will ask you about your cough and how it affects your quality of life. This study is placebo-controlled-this means that some participants will receive the investigational study drug, and some will receive something called a "placebo".  These are tablets that look identical to the investigational study drug but contain no actual medicine.  You will be randomly assigned to either the investigational study drug or the placebo, which is like picking straws to decide which treatment you will get. Please contact me today on 727-393-8067 if you, or someone you know, is interested in joining the VOLCANO-2 Study and helping us with this important research.  I will be happy to answer any questions that you might have.  If you do contact us, you are under no obligation to join the study. Thank you for reading about the VOLCANO-2 Study, and we look forward to hearing from you soon. Sincerely, Dr. Mandel Sher @ 727-393-8067

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough are now enrolling participants in cough studies evaluating new cough drugs. The VOLCANO-2 Study is described here.

item.title: Chronic Cough Takes the Podium 3 Times at 2017 Annual Scientific Meeting of American College of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
Chronic Cough Takes the Podium 3 Times at the 2017 Annual Scientific Meeting of the American College of Allergy, Asthma & Immunology (ACAAI).  Just back from this meeting, Dr. Sher is feeling energized!

"Chronic Cough" topics were featured 3 times in ACAAI's program.

Dr. Mandel Sher and colleagues from San Francisco and Colorado presented two sessions, and Dr. Sher's esteemed colleagues from the United Kingdom, New York, and Baltimore were featured at the plenary session:

  • Drs. Mandel Sher and Alan Goldsobel (of San Francisco area) presented:  "New Approaches to Chronic Cough in Children and Adults"
  • Drs. Mandel Sher and William Storms (of Colorado) presented:  "How to Start a Center of Excellence:  The Cough Center Experience"
  • Drs. Jaclyn Smith (of University of Manchester, UK), Peter Dicpinigatis (of Albert Einstein College of Medicine in NYC), and Brendan Canning (of Johns Hopkins) presented:  "Emerging Concepts in Chronic Cough." This plenary session to an audience of thousands featured Dr. Canning speaking on:  "The Search for the Human Cough Receptor(s)."  Dr. Smith addressed:  "The Cough Hypersensitivity Syndrome:  Diagnostic Approach to Chronic Cough in Adults."  And, Dr. Dicpinigaitis discussed:  "The New Therapeutic Approach to Chronic Cough in Adults."
Dr. Sher is a life-long learner and teacher.  He regularly participates in professional society meetings and appreciates the value of long-term colleagial relationships, formal and informal opportunities for discussion and idea sharing, and progress updates that are relevant to treating patients with Chronic Cough.

Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough's approach to evaluating and treating patients with Chronic Cough is supported by the experience and findings of world-class Cough experts. 

Dr. Sher founded Center for Cough in the Tampa Bay area of Florida in 2009.  Dr. Sher appreciates that Chronic Cough is a distinct medical condition and as such, deserves a separate identity and focus. Since establishing Center for Cough, Dr. Sher and Center for Cough team evaluate and treat people with Persistent Cough from the Tampa Bay region and from other originating destinations near and far.  Dr. Sher's Cough patients are achieving REMARKABLE RESULTS:

More than 8 out of 10 Cough patients demonstrate a measurable reduction in Cough and report an overall improvement in the quality of daily life - even when they have seen many other doctors for Persistent Cough and failed other Cough therapies.

Dr. Sher WILL help you resolve your Chronic Cough.  Please contact him at: Center for Cough:  727-393-8067.  www.centerforcough.com.

item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded: [caption id="attachment_3510" align="alignnone" width="300"] ...Make 2018 the Year You Finally Got Rid of Your Chronic Cough.[/caption]

item.title: Find Clinical Trials
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_breaking='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-dqe7s2'] [av_heading heading='Currently Enrolling Clinical Trials' tag='h1' link_apply='' link='' link_target='' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' margin='' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' custom_class='' id='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' av_uid='av-3m75bm'][/av_heading] [/av_one_full] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av_uid='av-8lsro2'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' av_uid='av-83k9eq' id='' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg=''] The Clinical Research Center at Center for Cough in Pinellas County is currently enrolling patients in two Cough clinical trials. Please call Sheila at Center for Cough to learn about these two clinical studies and enroll: 727-393- 8067. You do not need to be an established patient of Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough in order to enroll in a clinical study. Once you enroll in a clinical trial, you will experience the same standard of excellence and world-class care and service as Center for Cough patients. Please let Sheila know that you are interested in being contacted when additional clinical trials for your condition become available. And please share this information with others who may benefit from a clinical trial as a treatment option. [/av_textblock] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av_uid='av-5ncof6'] [av_heading heading='Past Studies' tag='h3' link_apply='' link='' link_target='' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' margin='' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' custom_class='' id='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-2p38de'] Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough have been conducting research studies since 2009. While the majority of trials involve medications for the treatment of Chronic Cough, The Clinical Research Center at Center for Cough has conducted numerous studies of drugs for:
  • Chronic Cough
  • Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
  • Asthma
  • Allergy
  • Other chronic respiratory diseases
  • Devices to improve nasal delivery of medication
Dr. Mandel Sher and the Center for Cough team are proud to have participated in clinical trials that have resulted in FDA approval of new medications and devices that are now household names and available to the general public. [/av_textblock]

item.title: What-is-clinical-research
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded:
[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_breaking='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading heading='Frequently Asked Questions' tag='h1' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg=''][/av_heading] [av_image src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/clinical-research-volunteer-1500x630.jpg' attachment='3600' attachment_size='featured_large' align='center' styling='' hover='' link='' target='' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation' admin_preview_bg=''][/av_image] [/av_one_full] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide=''] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg=''] The Clinical Research Center is a division of Center for Cough. Dr. Mandel Sher is the founder of Center for Cough and the Principal Investigator on all clinical trials conducted here. This page introduces you to clinical research and why you may consider volunteering for a clinical trial to make a difference for yourself and generations to come Dr. Mandel Sher and our team appreciate your interest in clinical research and consideration of participation. What are the potential benefits of me participating in clinical research? You do not need to be an established patient at Center for Cough to qualify for a clinical trial. There are two potential benefits of participating in clinical research: a direct benefit to you and a benefit to others who are now or sometime in the future suffering from the same medical condition. By participating in a clinical trial, you will have access to a drug or device that is not yet available to the public. The drug or device that is being studied may have a direct health benefit to you, your Cough, and your overall outcome. You will also have access to the world-class Cough care and treatment of Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough team. Other benefits include:
  • Free office visits, laboratory and other procedures related to the study
  • Health insurance is not required
  • Possible financial compensation for time, travel and participation
  • Free study drug
  • Appointment scheduling that accommodates your schedule
What is clinical research also known as clinical trials or clinical studies? Clinical trials are research studies that investigate new treatments or devices. The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) reviews and analyzes information from clinical trials to determine whether a drug or device should be approved and made available to the public. Medications that are available now have resulted from successful clinical research and FDA approval. Clinical trials give patients access to cutting-edge treatments before they become available to the public. In addition to acting proactively to benefit yourself now, by volunteering for a clinical trial you will be helping others by advancing tomorrow’s medicines today. Why is clinical research important? Clinical studies offer patients a treatment option that may not otherwise be available or a better treatment option. Clinical research adds to the body of knowledge in the medical community and advances treatment. In addition to benefiting volunteers today, successful clinical trials may benefit many people tomorrow. How are doctors selected to lead clinical trials? Not all doctors meet the standards to lead clinical trials. Doctors are selected based on rigorous review of their practice’s quality and ability to execute a clinical study according to the clinical trial's protocol. Because patients rely on their doctors to direct their treatment, and because only few doctors offer clinical research as a treatment option, it behooves patients to conduct an internet search for clinical trials that may help their medical condition. As a clinical research volunteer, you will enjoy the same outstanding patient experience as Center for Cough patients. This includes your care in a private and professional medical setting by an experienced and caring team who appreciate the contribution you are making to improved treatment options. Dr. Mandel Sher and the clinical research team become familiar with each and every clinical trials volunteer and are available to address your care and questions. Are clinical trials safe?     Your safety is our first and foremost concern.  Safety begins with you choosing a clinical research site that has demonstrated a track record of successful research, and you understanding the potential risks and rewards of the clinical trial for your condition.  Our clinical research is compliant with FDA guidelines including an informed consent process and monitoring by a review board of professionals who are not directly connected with the research. Your confidence and comfort matters. Please call (727) 393-8067 to contact our Clinical Research Nurse Coordinator, who will happily discuss the clinical research process as well as the specific clinical trial you are considering. What is a typical clinical research experience?   Once you contact Clinical Research Center and let us know of your interest in volunteering for a clinical trial, we will work with you to find an appropriate study. We will have an initial telephone conversation to discuss the study opportunity. We will also screen you to ensure that you meet the basic study requirements and that the potential benefits of the study drug are in your best interest. Each volunteer will be advised of the potential benefits and risks as well as rights of participation. An informed consent form will be signed and then the enrollment process is complete. Once you are enrolled in a study, you will be randomly assigned to a treatment course that is not even know by your doctor or research nurse coordinator. The protocol for the study is similar to following a recipe. There are defined steps and milestones for study visits and what will be done at each visit. May I participate in more than one Clinical Trial? Yes, but only one at a time, please. Many of our clinical trial participants have such a positive experience that they enroll in another study when their current trial is complete. When does a study drug become available for FDA approval? There are 3 phases of clinical trials:
  • Phase I: First step after the new treatment has shown promise in the laboratory. Typically involves healthy volunteers. Phase I trial generally assesses the study drug’s safety.
  • Phase II: Involves a larger group of participants than Phase I. This phase generally evaluates whether the study drug has a positive effect on the condition.
  • Phase III: Involves an even larger group of participants than Phase II. Phase III trial compares the new treatment with the currently approved standard treatment. If a Phase III trial shows that the new treatment is safe and more effective than current standard treatments, an application for FDA approval may be submitted.
Will the study cost me anything? No. Access to Dr. Mandel Sher’s expertise and medical services are at no cost to you. Health insurance is not required. Clinical research volunteers receive doctor visits, lab tests, study drugs and other related services at no cost. In addition, volunteers are often financially compensated for their time and travel. How can I learn about clinical trials for my cough and find out if I qualify? Dr. Mandel Sher is one of the nation’s leading clinical research investigators. As such, Clinical Research Center division of Center for Cough is frequently offering new clinical trials. People suffering with Cough may participate in one clinical trial at a time, but may enroll in another study once they have completed another. In fact, many of our Cough patients have had such positive experiences as a clinical research participant that they enroll in clinical trials over and over again. So, if you don’t qualify for one study, try again! Each clinical trial has specific participation requirements. We will work with you to find a clinical research study that is right for you.  And if you have a family member, friend or colleague who may benefit from one of Clinical Research Center’s clinical trials, please encourage them to let us know their interest. We welcome their participation. Please continue to check our current clinical trials page or Center for Cough’s facebook page to find out about our latest cough clinical trials.  We also invite you to contact our Center for Cough’s Clinical Research Nurse Coordinator, at (727) 393-8067 to discuss current and upcoming clinical trials. Sheila maintains a list of people interested in clinical research and will be happy to reach out to you when an appropriate study becomes available. [/av_textblock]

[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_breaking='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-9rcea7'] [av_heading heading='Frequently Asked Questions' tag='h1' style='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' padding='10' color='' custom_font='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-77z7sf'][/av_heading] [av_image src='http://centerforcough.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/clinical-research-volunteer-1500x630.jpg' attachment='3600' attachment_size='featured_large' align='center' styling='' hover='' link='' target='' caption='' font_size='' appearance='' overlay_opacity='0.4' overlay_color='#000000' overlay_text_color='#ffffff' animation='no-animation' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-5b7fpb'][/av_image] [/av_one_full] [av_hr class='default' height='50' shadow='no-shadow' position='center' custom_border='av-border-thin' custom_width='50px' custom_border_color='' custom_margin_top='30px' custom_margin_bottom='30px' icon_select='yes' custom_icon_color='' icon='ue808' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av_uid='av-4b2upr'] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-2q4yf3'] The Clinical Research Center is a division of Center for Cough. Dr. Mandel Sher is the founder of Center for Cough and the Principal Investigator on all clinical trials conducted here. This page introduces you to clinical research and why you may consider volunteering for a clinical trial to make a difference for yourself and generations to come Dr. Mandel Sher and our team appreciate your interest in clinical research and consideration of participation. What are the potential benefits of me participating in clinical research? You do not need to be an established patient at Center for Cough to qualify for a clinical trial. There are two potential benefits of participating in clinical research: a direct benefit to you and a benefit to others who are now or sometime in the future suffering from the same medical condition. By participating in a clinical trial, you will have access to a drug or device that is not yet available to the public. The drug or device that is being studied may have a direct health benefit to you, your Cough, and your overall outcome. You will also have access to the world-class Cough care and treatment of Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough team. Other benefits include:
  • Free office visits, laboratory and other procedures related to the study
  • Health insurance is not required
  • Possible financial compensation for time, travel and participation
  • Free study drug
  • Appointment scheduling that accommodates your schedule
What is clinical research also known as clinical trials or clinical studies? Clinical trials are research studies that investigate new treatments or devices. The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) reviews and analyzes information from clinical trials to determine whether a drug or device should be approved and made available to the public. Medications that are available now have resulted from successful clinical research and FDA approval. Clinical trials give patients access to cutting-edge treatments before they become available to the public. In addition to acting proactively to benefit yourself now, by volunteering for a clinical trial you will be helping others by advancing tomorrow’s medicines today. Why is clinical research important? Clinical studies offer patients a treatment option that may not otherwise be available or a better treatment option. Clinical research adds to the body of knowledge in the medical community and advances treatment. In addition to benefiting volunteers today, successful clinical trials may benefit many people tomorrow. How are doctors selected to lead clinical trials? Not all doctors meet the standards to lead clinical trials. Doctors are selected based on rigorous review of their practice’s quality and ability to execute a clinical study according to the clinical trial's protocol. Because patients rely on their doctors to direct their treatment, and because only few doctors offer clinical research as a treatment option, it behooves patients to conduct an internet search for clinical trials that may help their medical condition. As a clinical research volunteer, you will enjoy the same outstanding patient experience as Center for Cough patients. This includes your care in a private and professional medical setting by an experienced and caring team who appreciate the contribution you are making to improved treatment options. Dr. Mandel Sher and the clinical research team become familiar with each and every clinical trials volunteer and are available to address your care and questions. Are clinical trials safe?     Your safety is our first and foremost concern.  Safety begins with you choosing a clinical research site that has demonstrated a track record of successful research, and you understanding the potential risks and rewards of the clinical trial for your condition.  Our clinical research is compliant with FDA guidelines including an informed consent process and monitoring by a review board of professionals who are not directly connected with the research. Your confidence and comfort matters. Please call (727) 393-8067 to contact our Clinical Research Nurse Coordinator, who will happily discuss the clinical research process as well as the specific clinical trial you are considering. What is a typical clinical research experience?   Once you contact Clinical Research Center and let us know of your interest in volunteering for a clinical trial, we will work with you to find an appropriate study. We will have an initial telephone conversation to discuss the study opportunity. We will also screen you to ensure that you meet the basic study requirements and that the potential benefits of the study drug are in your best interest. Each volunteer will be advised of the potential benefits and risks as well as rights of participation. An informed consent form will be signed and then the enrollment process is complete. Once you are enrolled in a study, you will be randomly assigned to a treatment course that is not even know by your doctor or research nurse coordinator. The protocol for the study is similar to following a recipe. There are defined steps and milestones for study visits and what will be done at each visit. May I participate in more than one Clinical Trial? Yes, but only one at a time, please. Many of our clinical trial participants have such a positive experience that they enroll in another study when their current trial is complete. When does a study drug become available for FDA approval? There are 3 phases of clinical trials:
  • Phase I: First step after the new treatment has shown promise in the laboratory. Typically involves healthy volunteers. Phase I trial generally assesses the study drug’s safety.
  • Phase II: Involves a larger group of participants than Phase I. This phase generally evaluates whether the study drug has a positive effect on the condition.
  • Phase III: Involves an even larger group of participants than Phase II. Phase III trial compares the new treatment with the currently approved standard treatment. If a Phase III trial shows that the new treatment is safe and more effective than current standard treatments, an application for FDA approval may be submitted.
Will the study cost me anything? No. Access to Dr. Mandel Sher’s expertise and medical services are at no cost to you. Health insurance is not required. Clinical research volunteers receive doctor visits, lab tests, study drugs and other related services at no cost. In addition, volunteers are often financially compensated for their time and travel. How can I learn about clinical trials for my cough and find out if I qualify? Dr. Mandel Sher is one of the nation’s leading clinical research investigators. As such, Clinical Research Center division of Center for Cough is frequently offering new clinical trials. People suffering with Cough may participate in one clinical trial at a time, but may enroll in another study once they have completed another. In fact, many of our Cough patients have had such positive experiences as a clinical research participant that they enroll in clinical trials over and over again. So, if you don’t qualify for one study, try again! Each clinical trial has specific participation requirements. We will work with you to find a clinical research study that is right for you.  And if you have a family member, friend or colleague who may benefit from one of Clinical Research Center’s clinical trials, please encourage them to let us know their interest. We welcome their participation. Please continue to check our current clinical trials page or Center for Cough’s facebook page to find out about our latest cough clinical trials.  We also invite you to contact our Center for Cough’s Clinical Research Nurse Coordinator, at (727) 393-8067 to discuss current and upcoming clinical trials. Sheila maintains a list of people interested in clinical research and will be happy to reach out to you when an appropriate study becomes available. [/av_textblock]

item.title: Clinical Trial Volunteer Experiences
item.dc:creator: Karen Sher
item.content:encoded: [av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_breaking='' mobile_display=''] [av_heading tag='h1' padding='10' heading='Clinical Trial Volunteer Experiences' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size=''][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg=''] 75% of the U.S. population does not know that volunteering for a clinical trial may offer them a treatment option for their medical condition that is not available to the general public. Most doctors don’t participate in clinical research because of the intensive quality, administrative, and regulatory scrutiny.  Since most of us trust our doctors to guide our treatment and most doctors don’t participate in clinical research, many patients don’t know to ask about clinical research options and don’t know how to find them on their own. Thank You for being your own best advocate and finding Clinical Research Center at Center for Cough. Research shows that 98% of study volunteers have such a positive experience that they would consider participating in another study. Here's what a few of our recent clinical trial volunteers have to say about their experience.  You do not have to be an established patient at Center for Cough to participate in a clinical trial.  Please contact Center for Cough to express your interest in volunteering for a clinical study.  Once you are enrolled, you will experience the same stand of excellence and world-class care and service as all Center for Cough patients.  Please click on the Patient Success Stories link to read what Center for Cough's patients have to say. [/av_textblock] [av_testimonials style='slider_large' columns='2' grid_style='' interval='5' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' admin_preview_bg=''] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Mickey S.' subtitle='' link='http://' linktext=''] I went to see Dr. Sher about 4 years ago with a chronic cough I got from radiation in 2001. My cough is awful and it is a very, very hard cough. He has tried so many things and if it hasn’t worked, he tells me he won't give up on me, I still have other things I'm working.   He is involved in a research program that includes a a pill they are testing. It is a very big success in Europe and I was the first patient to try it. It worked while II was on the pill I did not cough. I was so happy as he said from the start, “don't give up on me and I didn't. The next survey doesn't start until January of 2017 every time I go and see him I ask him where is my pill.   I think he is the best! I have been to so many doctors since 2001 and they all told me there is nothing they can do and I would have to live with the cough but Dr. Sher never gave up on me he keeps looking for something to help me . I think he is the greatest I even made him a t-shirt that says bow ties are cool it also has a bow tie I embroidered. Thanks Dr. Sher for everything you are doing for me. [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Trudy' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] Just finished a trial for a new cough medicine – Great experience and the medicine really helped [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Jan' subtitle='' link='' linktext=''] I was suffering from Chronic Cough for years.  Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough team have helped me achieve great results.  I'm coughing less and now know how to identify the early warning signs of a cough attach and nip it in the bud before it begins. One of the treatment options they offered me, was volunteering for a clinical trial of a cough study drug.  I was a bit nervous but Dr. Sher and his caring,professional and knowledgeable research team answered my questions and created a welcoming and comfortable environment. The process was well-organized and Dr. Sher and his team were very accommodating about scheduling.  And, the study drug worked!  In addition to benefiting from the study drug myself, I feel so good that I helped with the research for new cough drugs that will someday help others.  I would definitely volunteer for another clinical trial.  Thank You Dr. Sher and Center for Cough! [/av_testimonial_single] [/av_testimonials] [/av_one_full]

[av_one_full first min_height='' vertical_alignment='' space='' custom_margin='' margin='0px' padding='0px' border='' border_color='' radius='0px' background_color='' src='' background_position='top left' background_repeat='no-repeat' animation='' mobile_breaking='' mobile_display='' av_uid='av-c4pygj'] [av_heading tag='h1' padding='10' heading='Clinical Trial Volunteer Experiences' color='' style='' custom_font='' size='' subheading_active='' subheading_size='15' custom_class='' admin_preview_bg='' av-desktop-hide='' av-medium-hide='' av-small-hide='' av-mini-hide='' av-medium-font-size-title='' av-small-font-size-title='' av-mini-font-size-title='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' av_uid='av-12zyxf'][/av_heading] [av_textblock size='' font_color='' color='' av-medium-font-size='' av-small-font-size='' av-mini-font-size='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-9f2v8z'] 75% of the U.S. population does not know that volunteering for a clinical trial may offer them a treatment option for their medical condition that is not available to the general public. Most doctors don’t participate in clinical research because of the intensive quality, administrative, and regulatory scrutiny.  Since most of us trust our doctors to guide our treatment and most doctors don’t participate in clinical research, many patients don’t know to ask about clinical research options and don’t know how to find them on their own. Thank You for being your own best advocate and finding Clinical Research Center at Center for Cough. Research shows that 98% of study volunteers have such a positive experience that they would consider participating in another study. Here's what a few of our recent clinical trial volunteers have to say about their experience.  You do not have to be an established patient at Center for Cough to participate in a clinical trial.  Please contact Center for Cough to express your interest in volunteering for a clinical study.  Once you are enrolled, you will experience the same stand of excellence and world-class care and service as all Center for Cough patients.  Please click on the Patient Success Stories link to read what Center for Cough's patients have to say. [/av_textblock] [av_testimonials style='slider_large' columns='2' grid_style='' interval='5' font_color='' custom_title='' custom_content='' admin_preview_bg='' av_uid='av-7bww4j'] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Mickey S.' subtitle='' link='http://' linktext='' av_uid='av-6am32r'] I went to see Dr. Sher about 4 years ago with a chronic cough I got from radiation in 2001. My cough is awful and it is a very, very hard cough. He has tried so many things and if it hasn’t worked, he tells me he won't give up on me, I still have other things I'm working.   He is involved in a research program that includes a a pill they are testing. It is a very big success in Europe and I was the first patient to try it. It worked while II was on the pill I did not cough. I was so happy as he said from the start, “don't give up on me and I didn't. The next survey doesn't start until January of 2017 every time I go and see him I ask him where is my pill.   I think he is the best! I have been to so many doctors since 2001 and they all told me there is nothing they can do and I would have to live with the cough but Dr. Sher never gave up on me he keeps looking for something to help me . I think he is the greatest I even made him a t-shirt that says bow ties are cool it also has a bow tie I embroidered. Thanks Dr. Sher for everything you are doing for me. [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Trudy' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-44uvgz'] Just finished a trial for a new cough medicine – Great experience and the medicine really helped [/av_testimonial_single] [av_testimonial_single src='' name='Jan' subtitle='' link='' linktext='' av_uid='av-2y7doz'] I was suffering from Chronic Cough for years.  Dr. Mandel Sher and Center for Cough team have helped me achieve great results.  I'm coughing less and now know how to identify the early warning signs of a cough attach and nip it in the bud before it begins. One of the treatment options they offered me, was volunteering for a clinical trial of a cough study drug.  I was a bit nervous but Dr. Sher and his caring,professional and knowledgeable research team answered my questions and created a welcoming and comfortable environment. The process was well-organized and Dr. Sher and his team were very accommodating about scheduling.  And, the study drug worked!  In addition to benefiting from the study drug myself, I feel so good that I helped with the research for new cough drugs that will someday help others.  I would definitely volunteer for another clinical trial.  Thank You Dr. Sher and Center for Cough! [/av_testimonial_single] [/av_testimonials] [/av_one_full]
